Reviews.Title: “Best stylish, quirky, cool hotel in Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Smurf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in April, on the 2nd floor room 32 with a canal view room. Room was clean, stylish & had everything you need. We enjoyed watching dvd`s in the room on the large lcd tv on the wall. We were able to select a dvd from a wide selection free of charge. The fridge in the room contained complimentary drinks which was fab. The bed & pillows were very comfy, even my girlfriend found them just fab even though she is pregnant. The honesty bar downstairs was a fab idea & a real surprise. The breakfast was great as was served between 9-11, which suited us. Each morning we were given something different with our breakfast as a special treat, which was a nice touch. The owners were very helpful all the time, carried bags up/downstairs, recommended places to eat each night which each time were great. They told us about all the sights of Amsterdam & where they were by putting them down on a map for us. The time we were there was for my girlfriends 30th birthday, so I made a special request before I went to have balloons, flowers & chocolates in the room which was done, I cannot fault what they picked as it was to my standard, just fab. I would defo recommend this hotel to one & all, just book it now. We both plan to go back again next year once the baby is born :-)

Reviews.Title: “Easy to see why this place is No.1”
Reviews.Author: Collegeprof101
Reviews.Content: We had four nights staying at the Mauro in early April to celebrate our ninth wedding anniversary (and ten years since our engagement in Amsterdam). Everything everyone else says about this place is right. We were in Room 32 - Canal view and found it to be overall an excellent experience. Are there negative things you can say about this place - well of course nowhere is perfect. I would have liked an extractor in the bathroom and the hand towels are kind of small but then hey that's really nitpicking. What makes this place stand out are Berry and Marcel. Nothing is too much bother for them. They'll take your bags up and down to your room. Recommend and book you restaurants and fast track entry tickets to museums. Breakfast is almost a piece of performance art as you head downstairs wondering what Berry's little surprise treat of the day is - we had fresh pineapple, Dutch pancakes (natch), fresh fruit and yoghurt and beautiful Dutch pastries. There is a great collection of DVDs and CDs to watch/listen to in your room if the weather closes in, the most reasonably priced honesty bar anywhere in the world and of course the welcome drinks in your room when you arrive. Is there any reason not to consider going here - no. It is the best hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else in Amsterdam? This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: The_Boulevardier
Reviews.Content: Well, it is going to be hard to keep this place a secret since it is one of the top places to stay in Amsterdam through tripadvisor. But let me tell you, Mauro Mansion is a great find! Located only minutes from the Central Train Station and within minutes of great attractions, shoppping, dining, and nightlife, this hotel offers more for the money than many other places. And the friendly and courteous staff is a HUGE asset. Our room was large with a fantastic, postcard-perfect view of a canal outside our large windows. And what other place offers you a one-night complimentary mini bar?! Unheard of. You are going to love Amsterdam, perhaps as much as I did, and you will want to return, just like I do, and you will want to come back and stay at the Mauro Mansion because there is simply no better place to stay for such a great value. I would recommend this hotel to my dearest value-conscious friends who are looking to experience the wonders of Dutch friendliness and service within walking distance to all of the great culture that Amsterdam has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: SarahEmy
Reviews.Content: We arrived after missing our flights and quite a stressful journey but within minutes of arriving at Mauro all was forgotten. We were greeted by Berry, he helped us carry our bags up to our room. And left us to settle in. There were drinks free in the fridge. We asked for a restaurant recommendation. It was perfect. We had left 5 children behind and we were able to kick back and totally relax. The hotel was so peaceful. Lovely music in the honesty bar. The location was perfect, no traipsing for ages from the train station to find your hotel. You are in the red light district but very easy to avoid if you wish. The area seemed very safe. We did a lot walking, it was always easy to drop back to mauro with your shopping bags or to get changed for dinner. You can purchase wine, beer and snacks at the Honesty bar if you return home late and want something. We borrowed some of the DVD's and had a bottle champagne. We stayed in courtyard room at the top of house. We no problems with street noise. To be honest, after all the nice meals out we needed a little extra exercise, so the stairs wasn't an issue for us. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They run a lovely business with some extra special little touches. Breakfast was great, really set you up for all the walking we did. There was really nice coffee avail to take away too. The beds were really comfortable. You can control the heat in your room if got cold. The only fault we found was we thought there should have been extractor/ventilation fans in the bathroom. And the towels were a little smaller than standard bath towels. We would highly recommend Mauro mansion. We really loved our stay. Thanks again. : )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - fantastically located and quality amenities”
Reviews.Author: NathanRM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mauro for a business trip from March 18-21. The hotel is ideally located to central station and in the hub of activity that is Amsterdam. One can easily walk to everything and the rooms were fantastic. Our primary place of business was the RAI convention centre and that was very easily accessable via metro train located at central station. All of the business functions were held in venues in Amsterdam central and again these were all within walking distance of the hotel. We had 2 canal view rooms (one lower level and the other 1st level). the lower level was great and absolutely no issues with noise, but if you can manage to get higher level canal view rooms (and don't mind steep stairs - this is Europe after all!) then I would highly recommend it as the view is spectacular and the rooms a bit bigger (than the ground level). The breakfeast was great too - fresh bread and freshly squeezed juices are a highlight! All in all a fantastic hotel and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to the business or leisure traveller - I would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Everything was as we expected, small ( 9 rooms ), well situated, quirky hotel, well run by Berry & Marcel. Close to the Central Station ( 3 mins walk ) we walked everywhere never needing to use public transport. Choose a room overlooking canal if possible, excellent breakfast with healthy options, beware, there is no lift and the staircase is steep and narrow. Another bonus for us was the fact there were no young children which makes for a much more relaxed stay. We had a birthday whilst we were there and appreciated the complimentary bottle of fizz from the owners. Honesty bar on ground floor was a nice touch. Only 400 metres from the Red Light District but easy to avoid if you wish? If we return to Amsterdam, we would stay here again so I guess that speaks volumes?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..excellent..”
Reviews.Author: jlb27
Reviews.Content: No wonder why this place is #1 in tripadvisor.. I absolutely LOVE this place..stayed there for 3 nights during a business trip..a very nice welcoming - which hotel will offer you a drink the first minute you stepped in? (well beside maybe all those 5* ones maybe). My room was massive and nicely funky decorated..bathroom fanstastic, with a separate shower and a massive bubble bathtub..all the toiletry were nice and well layed out. On my bed, there was some welcoming chocolate and instructions of the hotel. The free mini bar came very handy..and gosh, the prosecco were sooo nice and refreshing. Did not have time to taste much of the breakfast as it starts at 9am and i had to leave for work at around 8am..but Berry made it handy for me to grab something to eat and drink in the morning. Their selection of drinks and snacks with the honesty bar is very good if you fancy something in the night. The hotel is soo well located: 2-3mins walk from central station, restaurants and bars are all nearby. Although it is close to red light district, it is a safe area to walk at night time. On my last day,there was no train to Schiphol airport, and Berry gave me all the info for public transport to get there,as taxi was a minimum of â‚¬50!!! Overall, i can HIGHLY recommend this place..and cannot wait to go back to Amsterdam to stay there.. Service, location, honesty, friendliness.. They all fit into this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ... Wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: GeziyozBiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mauro Mansion for three nights in 16 - 19 March 2012. Our room is very nice and comfortable. (Room Number is 22 / Canal View.) Wonderful location for all major places. Breakfast is beatiful and healthly. if we come to Amsterdam again, we will definitely stay hear.

Reviews.Title: “A personal touch”
Reviews.Author: FrankTravelers
Reviews.Content: We checked in 11.February for 4 nights. Felt very welcome n warm reception even though it was an extremely cold morning. Practical accommodation as location is superb n close to the central station. Staff r very helpful n friendly about any tour related queries we had. We broke a wine glass n they didn't make a fuss about it. On Valentine's Day they surprised us with a complimentary bottle of good champagne. We felt so safe staying here n breakfast is always good n practical. We will definitely return to this hotel if we visit Amsterdam again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, centrally located, relaxing, easy going stay”
Reviews.Author: nichollsb01
Reviews.Content: Booked the Mauro Mansion based on reviews and value for money and I wasn't disappointed! It is very easy to find, 5 mins from station. Yes, it's next door to the Red Light District but you don't really notice and you can easily walk round it. Was made to feel welcome from the moment I booked, friendly emails and when my preferred room became available I was notified and moved - fabulous! Our room was courtyard and directly above the breakfast room. It was very clean (& I'm very funny about the cleanliness of hotel rooms!) We enjoyed the quirky decorating. Two slight gripes - the lockers were short so my husband's clothes were squashed and as it was above the breakfast room we could often hear music, not really an issue but slightly annoying. Breakfast was fabulous, fresh food, loved the pate and the extra dishes (pancakes, strawberries, sweet breads) were a lovely touch. Was great to be able to borrow DVDs after a days walking. If I was to return to Amsterdam I would stay here again. If you want a chain hotel then stay at one, if you want quirky and Amsterdam stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Biggles2390
Reviews.Content: But confused as to why this is number one. Maybe I expected too much after reading all the glowing reviews but I was severely disappointed. Stayed in a canal room which became very noisy at night. As for the area, my partner and I very nearly got mugged on the street outside the hotel. The room itself was ok, awful smell obviously coming from the toilet which was nauseating! One tiny wardrobe as well to store your stuff. I appreciated the free mini bar but would have to say we had little/no communication with the owners, we decided against asking them for anything after we kept getting strange looks from them when we tried to. Also as a couple travelling was disappointed to have two twin beds pushed together? Will definitely not be back and as mentioned am disappointed as I was so looking forward to the experience. Maybe I was just unlucky though as there are so many other positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: swilly2000
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, romantic and convenient, we stayed there last week and enjoyed a lot from the room, breakfasts and hospitality of the owners. The view from the canal room just fantastic and free minibar in the room is a nice surprise. I would recommend it to any couple that have a romantic holiday in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Best place we have stayed at in Europe/UK”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui M
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion was a great place to stay - Berry and Marcel were lovely and very helpful. They were happy to book us into restaurants for dinner and gave us a great dinner recommendation. Breakfast was very healthy and fresh, the room was extremely clean and the location great. We stayed in a canal room which had a great view, the night-time noise didn't bother us at all and the welcome drinks in the mini-bar were a great touch. On our return trip to Europe later this year we will definitely be staying at Mauro Mansion again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Toronto1975
Reviews.Content: Thank you Berry & Marcel for a wonderful stay. Couldn't have asked for a nicer, more stylish accommodation. The breakfasts were superb. We really appreciated your warm hospitality and all the great recommendations for visiting Amsterdam. Hope we can return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: S G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last weekend of Feb & it was great! Berry & Marcel were really nice, the place is very clean & just gorgeous! Breakfast is really nice quality. It's got such a great thing about it, that it attracts really sound people. Deffo recommend it mainly for couples, or people travelling with 1 person or a close friend.

Reviews.Title: “Was there for just a single night and loved it”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an interesting place near the train station and city center. This place worked very well. I liked when I was having a bit of trouble finding the door, pulled out my phone, and their mobile site says in big text â€œIn town? Having trouble finding us?â€� Itâ€™s touches like that which reinforce that they really understand the guest experience and are there to make it great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, funky and great location!”
Reviews.Author: cpepperpot
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Mauro Mansion, it was the little touches which made this hotel so great. We arrived on Valentines Day, red and white heart shaped balloons, alongside a little chocolate were placed on our bed. The mini fridge was stocked with juice, beer and sparkling wine, free of charge! Each evening a different treat was left on our pillow (waffle cookies etc) and each morning an extra surprise at breakfast - freshly cut pineapple, mini pancakes, little pastries. These were on top of an already delicious breakfast of fresh fruit, local bread, meats and cheeses (stored in a funky red fridge by the breakfast table) and a coffee machine and selection of teas. Tea and coffee were available from reception all day. The honesty bar was an added bonus if you got the munchies late at night or fancied an extra glass of wine or beer. There were a selection of dvds and books which could be borrowed and an ipad and macbook available at reception at all times. The rooms were spacious and well equipped with ipod docking station, flatscreen tv and dvd player. Our bathroom had a deep bath, walk-in shower and fragrant toiletries. Mauro Mansion is located a few minutes away from central station and is walking distance to so many of the squares and local attractions. We were lucky enough for the ice to melt on the canals so that we could enjoy an hour cruise around the city. I totally recommend Mauro Mansion!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a few days”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Toria
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - 5 minute walk from central station, so no need for a taxi/tram. We had a room on the second floor with a courtyard view, we would have preferred a canal view, but booked late so was to be expected. The room was well equipped and flawlessly clean and tidy, and cleaned to perfect standards every morning. The facilities at the hotel were fantastic. Breakfast was great, with a little surprise treat each morning, the free use of wifi, iPad, MacBook, TV/DVD player in the room, the honesty bar... All fantastic. Owners are extremely friendly and happy to help with any queries you may have (they recommended a great Indonesian restaurant for us). Would certainly stay here again, and recommend to anyone wanting a relaxed few days away.

Reviews.Title: “First Choice for Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: farleysmom
Reviews.Content: Berry and Marcel are perfect hosts and staff is exceedingly friendly and helpful. Only drawback was no elevator, but they took luggage to and from room for us so we didn't have to struggle up 3 flights of stairs. The building is historical and all structural changes must be approved so no elevators. Plus is that rooms are large and have high ceilings. GREAT breakfasts - variety of cheeses and meats, the best whole grain bread ever, yogart, fruits, cereal, etc. Every morning there was a special dish freshly prepared for each guest - chocolate crepes, a fruit and yogart parfait, etc. There are drinks in lobby/breakfast area and you just tell them what you had when checking out. There is tv and vcr in room and large selection of dvds, cds and books to borrow. Lighting in room is poor if you like to read in bed. We loved the location - walking distance of everyplace we wanted to go and if you don't want to walk, rent a bicycle. Down the street there was red-light house which we did not notice until second evening. The "ladies" stood in narrow windows and beckoned and sometimes knocked to passerbys. Lots of good and relatively inexpensive restaurants nearby and if you want to eat in, there is a small refrigerator in rooms and serving utensils in breakfast area you can use. We HIGHLY recommend this place and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: angie1801
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in a street level canal room. We can only agree with all the positive comments about Mauro. Honesty bar, breakfast, free use of iPad, friendly owners and staff person. STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo50100
Reviews.Content: Really good place for my stay in Amsterdam. My room was so warm (-10Â° in Amsterdam with frozen canals) and comfortable; bathroom is big and the floor heating is fantastic. clean and really smart. Delicious breakfast and the hotel guys are really kind. I don't care if it's not in best part of Amsterdam (just few steps from Central Station) but from here you can reach all the most intersting place of Amsterdam. Definitely my place for Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Feb in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Small_town_Saskie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mauro Mansion in Amsterdam based on Trip Advisor reviews and we were happy with our stay. They provided excellent directions from the train station and we couldn't believe how close it was! The canal street is beautiful Upon arrival, I had booked a canal view room, but he cautioned me about the noise and maybe we would prefer a courtyard room? I asked to look at the courtyard room and he picked up my bag and proceeded to head up the stairs. He gave us the key. So I guess we were staying in the courtyard room. I chalk it up to a miss in communication, but I only wanted to look at the other room and then make my decision. We settled in and were happy with the room (but the canal view room was nicer). They did provide information on what to see in Amsterdam which was nice and the breakfast area was very nice. We had breakfast the next morning and it was fabulous. Fresh orange juice and a lovely assortment of breakfast items. They have put a lot of money into renovations and you can tell. The bathrooms are not typical European bathrooms and are very spacious and nice. This was our first trip to Amsterdam so we didn't know where anything was. This hotel is located close to the Red Light District, but it doesn't make the neigbourhood shady or anything. It is just far enough away! We were caught off guard by the offering of xxx movies in the lobby and the antique barber chair in our room. We were not sure how to take it and we still are not sure. Overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Abea7518
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend recently spent 2 nights at the Mauro Mansion, we booked it based on the trip advisor reviews we had seen. It lived up to all expectations as it was in a brilliant location, room was lovely and pristine and owners were very welcoming and helpful. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “for an unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: JOOST_533
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partener for 2 days and it was a great experience.The house is near the central station and the owners makes you feel at home.i higly reccomand this b&b especially for romantic nights in amsterdam in a city that never sleeps.it was more than i expected for taking in consideration the price.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant!!”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time to this city and this is by the best place we have stayed. Everything about this hotel was excellent, from the way we were greeted, food and our rooms. I cant fault this hotel at all. The most relaxing hotel I have personally have stayed in. We will definitely be back. Thank you Berrie.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Rio1323
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers and have stayed in many hotels. Mauro Mansions is not a hotel so don't expect room service. What they offer is so much more. Friendly, helpful, caring owners who run an exceptional and unique guest house. Where else would you find chilled wine soft drinks and beer in your bar fridge ALL complimentary? Beautiful toiletries and for the first time ever, 2 of everything!!! As 2 woman traveling together we are always asking for extra shower caps, shampoo etc... The honesty system they have with regard to snacks make you feel like a trusted guest. The rooms are spacious, clean and tasteful. With cute touches such as the hammock chair in our room. Close to the shops, red light district, train station and the trams, where else would you want to stay in Amsterdam.... NO WHERE ELSE

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JulieAnne12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while passing through Amsterdam. Believe the reviews - this place is fantastic. Charming building, clean rooms, great view, *very* centrally located (we walked over from the train station), friendly staff and great breakfast included. It's definitely a pricier option for anyone on a tight budget, but worth it if you want quality for your money. Would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Prepared for the Incredible Canal View!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoaster36
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mauro Mansion myself for one night in January of 2012. I booked the reservation based solely upon its Trip Advisor recommendations, and I am once again happy to report that this community did not disappoint. In my visit â€“ these are the aspects I really enjoyed: â€¢ The hotel is extraordinarily close to the train station, less then a five minute walk. It was easy to come in by train and ditch my bag. As I had to catch the train to Schiphol for a 9am flight, it was very easy to get back to the train in the early morning, and most importantly it felt quite safe. â€¢ I arrived on the day of my stay at around 11:00 am. The hotel proprietor generously still offered me breakfast at this late hour. While my room wasnâ€™t yet ready they gave me a city map, restaurant recommendations, and a room key. When I returned after sightseeing later that day they had already moved my bag into my room for me. â€¢ There is strong free wireless signal in the downstairs lobby, but also in the individual rooms. There is a laptop for guest use as well as a books, magazine and movies that can be borrowed. â€¢ My spacious canal facing room was huge and just amazingly beautiful. High ceilings, heated bathroom floors, deep soaking tub, contemporary furnishings, mosquito net, and a gorgeous view of the canals. The price was very very good for a room and a view like this. I love the mix of the design elements (like the sleek plastic rocking chair) with the historic elements (like fireplace & cross beams) â€¢ Apparently the Mauro building was once a notorious fetish hotel. While you would never know it, they kept little cheeky architectural remainders around. (My room had a rubber floor and a tiny ladder that led to a tiny cage on the roof of the bathroom!) I know it sounds weird but it adds to the design scheme and uniqueness of the hotel. â€¢ There were free welcome drinks of beer and sparking wine in the mini fridge! If you finish these the hotel offers a well stocked and very well priced honor bar in the main room, with interesting international selections.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded very high expectations”
Reviews.Author: My-Life-I-Sought
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mauro Mansion over New Years after seeing such positive reviews on Trip Advisor. As usual, the reviews did not lie....this B&B is outstanding! Located less than a 5 minute walk from the train station, yet on a quiet canal, Mauro Mansion is an excellent stepping off point to explore a remarkable city. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly, almost like family in a comforting way. Our room overlooked the canal and was exceptionally clean. The bathroom was ample with a great shower and excellent water pressure. The breakfast each morning was wonderful, coffee was free, extraordinary, and available 24/7, as were snacks. There was a charming 'honor bar' that was fully stocked and always open as well. Simply keep track of what you take and let them know at checkout. Attention to detail makes the Mauro Mansion what it is. NYE is famous in Amsterdam for LOTS of fireworks. Lots is a massive understatement, and they go on all night. We had no problem sleeping though, as the owners had thoughtfully placed earplugs beside our bed for when we decided to finally turn in. Ooh, and a bottle of Champagne on ice for a New Years toast. I almost feel sorry for those who visit Amsterdam and stay at one of the many nice hotels in the city. The Mauro Mansion is such a delight, and exceptional in every way. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its no.1 rating”
Reviews.Author: calby
Reviews.Content: Great b&b style accomodation, lovely decor. Berry and marcel friendly, lucky marcel alerted us at check-in that there was a strike on the Thalys train we were departing with when we check out so we could try make alternative arrangements. We were on the second floor and the stairs are steep - lucky our two 20kg+ suitcases were moved up and down by the staff. We were there for our wedding anniversary and we were delightfully surprised to find a bottle of champagne and roses on our arrival. Clean room, funky decor, mauro mansion had everything you can think of in an accomodation included dvds, ipad, laptop we could just use. Honesty bar was a great idea - at very good prices too! Very close to central station, quiet area close to both red light district and Chinatown. A great area to stay in overall. Great quality breakfast also included in tariff is a plus. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised THIS is #1 on tripadvisor!! ...there are far better”
Reviews.Author: 13inky
Reviews.Content: We booked this 'hotel' for two nights based on the stellar reviews on this site and the need to be close to central station for an early flight. Now, the service was very good, and they have alot on offer in terms of guide books you can use, a great well-priced range of snacks and wines, and free coffee and breakfast, including a pancake. However, there are far nicer hotels in Amsterdam (the Ambassade, for one!) For the value however, it's great. I suppose it's been so highly rated because of all the little extras, such as an ipad you can use and free welcome drinks. The Philips WakeUp lights are a great touch, however it'd be useful to have a manual (I could only figure it out because I'd recently bought one.) My issues are that no one managed to tell us how (or where) to turn on the heat, so we had to figure it out the hard way the next morning in a freezing bedroom. Typically, when a hotel is expecting guests, you'd think they would turn on the heat for you IN WINTER. Also, the bathroom smelled a bit off for my taste, and a vent would be a wise choice. As is stated on their website, the street level rooms are a bit noisy. What's not mentioned is that you hear everyone that comes and goes out of the building. Most people are respectful though. I think the owners have done a nice job with the place and if you want a small, place to stay that doesn't have a corporate look or feel, then I'd advise this place.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JAHNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mauro Nov. 2011; front room, canal view. The room would present some challenges had I been traveling with my partner; there was just enough space to hang and store my clothes- for two people it would have been tight. That aside, the room was large for AMS, airy, high ceilings, quiet. I find it amusing that people comment on the stairs as an issue- its AMS- anything built prior to 1950 has narrow winding stairs. My only reservation here was the location- great if you want to be near the Centraal Train station (if you are planning day trips by train out of AMS perfect location); but I found the adjacent RLD to be annoying and a bit grating. For the price and standard of attention this hotel is a great find. The room was pretty spotless (I am a clean freak so am highly critical); service impeccable (they arranged for me to get a much needed massage in my room one evening which I recommend to all with airplane fatigue).Would definitely stay there again; but would also consider staying closer to the Museum District just to avoid the rowdy bands of youths making the rounds thru the RLD. As I live in a major city I wanted to escape this kind of aggression; for others it may not be an issue. The location of the hotel is on a quiet street overlooking a canal- quite charming and peaceful considering the proximity to the central hub of AMS.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location”
Reviews.Author: Mungo69
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to all the bars, cafes, shops, red light district and railway station. A boutique hotel run by dedicated owners offering a tranquil resting place not far from the madding crowds! Small hotel that has a truly delightful individual style. Very relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in the Dam”
Reviews.Author: Beanie5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending New Year in Amsterdam and had a fantastic time, mainly due to the great stay at Mauro mansion. It's ideally situated near to Central Station, alongside a canal and close but not too close to China Town and the Red Light District. We were lucky to get a cancellation and stayed. in Room 32 which had lovely views of the canal. The owners think of everything - even ear plugs which we didnt need. The room was equipped with T.V and DVD player with lots of DVD's to borrow. A mini fridge which came filled with complimentary drinks, including a welcome bottle of champagne to celebrate the New Year. The bed was very comfy and there was a nice shower and deep bath. Underfloor heating in the bathroom was very nice. Breakfast was continental but there was plenty of choice and lots of it. Fresh coffee, juices, warm breads, cheeses and meat. The owners were very warm and friendly and even though we had ordered I Amsterdam tickets, they did not charge us for them as they would not be valid due to it being New Year and they would not have worked - thank you for that. Useful to have laptop and i-pad available to use too. Overall, if you are wanting to stay somewhere that's got it all then book this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Romantic Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: chrisk828
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last April for a little romantic getaway and we really appreciated their attention to detail. Large rooms, beautiful/stylish decor, helpful staff, good location, and the little additions that turn a good experience into a great experience. thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to stay, just trust us.”
Reviews.Author: Annora
Reviews.Content: This place is marvellous.We loved it and the owners too, they were super helpful and sweet. Breakfast was simply gorgeous, food was delicious and all locally sourced, organic, so perfect. Very close to the station, you just have to take the main exit or you'll get a bit lost! Love the honesty bar, we didnt have need to use it but it was super nice to have it there, and it was VERY VERY reasonably priced. Beds were divine and the heating was perfect. I cannot faul this place at all and highly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stylish boutique clean room comfy and warm great location 2mins from central station and red light district!”
Reviews.Author: leanneg88
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel...stylish rooms very romantic! Brill hotel owners..it was my bfs 35th and they chucked in some free extras including bottle of champs and rose petals in the shape of 35 also balloons! perfect breakfeast is limited however quality and will hold you to lunch time very fresh! 1 tiny tiny bad thing either the drains or the shower curtain smelt slightly damp! However we checked into another room by mistake before this and there was no problem of this.. overall if U want a romantic stay perfect boutique clean stylish hotel this is the 1 Location absolutley perfect in the centre of everywhere near station by red light district and dam square... Overall perfect trip perfect hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly n peaceful! if we can only choose the guests...”
Reviews.Author: Rj-spark
Reviews.Content: Mauro is located very close tithe Centraal station, and a very short distance away from the Dam, the red light district, etc etc. it's on a quiet street facing a canal. I stayed here 5 nights n enjoyed myself in Amsterdam thoroughly, even staying in on a couple of nights - I was tired n room was very inviting in itself with the DVD player, n a stack of DVDs to choose from, at the reception.. I wud rate the hotel very highly, but will add the following cautionary notes in any case: 1. Arriving at night is a bit troublesome for the 1st timer,, as getting out of the train station it gets dark, n you need to find your way there. 2. Steps are steep if you stay on the top (3rd?) floor, but manageable by most. 3. You can't help this, but some guests like to do "IT" at any time between 9pm - 2am. I did wish I did not have to experience the groans n moans, but alas.. In any case, this is the only thing that dampened my experience somewhat... (even the cold wintry fog was quite nice in the city!) Enjoy yr stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 1travelMD
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion met our expectations perfectly. The location only a few blocks from the train station is ideal. We were able to easily walk to major sites of interest. Our room on the third floor was comfortable and enjoyed a lovely view of the canal. The bathroom was clean and functional. Breakfast of high-quality local ingredients was excellent. There was a nice selection of tasty meats and cheeses plus juices and freshly baked breads. The coffee maker was available day and night, as was a computer and iPad. Most importantly, the pleasant hosts were present with wise advice about activities and restaurants. They are charming and justifiably proud of their small and lovely hotel. We recommend Mauro Mansion without reservations if you can climb the circular staircase that is an architectural feature of the canal house.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoxyRhino
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Amsterdam and after spending ages researching hotels, I looked on Tripadvisor, saw this site as the #1 and booked it. The hotel is in a great location (especially if you have a poor sense of direction as all you have to do to get home at night is find a tram or bus that stops at the Central Station) and you get very good directions from the station from the hosts. I stayed in room 11 on the ground floor and even though it was at ground level there was no problem with noise from outside (apart from one night when someone decided to beep their horn outside at 2am but it was that loud that even the best double glazing wouldn't be able to cope). The room was simple but had everything you could need (and free wi-fi) but a great change from identikit chain hotel rooms. Where else would you get an old wooden wardrobe to put your clothes and it was nice to have a little sweet treat on the pillow each day. Breakfast was great - fresh bread, juices, cereal, yogurt, cheese and a special something each day (in my case - fresh melon and yogurt with fruit). Even though the hotel is within walking distance of the Red Light District, most places in that area are and walking round, nowhere seemed a bad area to be in - Amsterdam is such a laid back place that it's a treat to walk round. Didn't need to use the honesty bar but everything seemed very reasonably priced (certainly nowhere near what you would pay in a chain hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good for location”
Reviews.Author: Chingsabung
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there, we tried 2 rooms, one on ground floor and one on the first floor that we prefered for noise and view, also slightly bigger. It was our first visit in Amsterdam so for us the location was perfect, not far from central station, not far from all the things to do. Rooms are simple and really clean but nothing special, not the big Wow. Breakfast was ok, the service was good but we did not have any special interaction with the host.

Reviews.Title: “If location is important this is it.”
Reviews.Author: sealeg
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for bus arrival from the Ferry Terrminal and Train. Dropped bags off early and went to my business meeting. Location was good for wife to wander safely around Amsterdam till room was ready. Bags were delivered to our room on 3rd floor which was a relief. The stairs are the most narrow that we've had in Europe and whilst fit enough to use them, its something I'd prefer to avoid in hindsight. Room decor isn't really us, but room was clean. Canal view was lovely and it was quiet. Missed breakfast as it does not start till 9am and we had to leave for early flight and was disappointed that no offer of bread to toast or juice even though owner was slowly getting it ready at 8am. Worth staying if room tariff is attractive and would stay on the 2nd floor if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STEPHENandDAISY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the begining of November 2011 with my girl. I really liked the hotel. I stayed on the ground floor and the room was big, and very clean. The room was quiet and I liked the idea of staying in a canal house. The owners were very nice and helpful, and had fastpasses for the different museums to skip the lines. I read a review on trip advisor where someone did not like the shower. I really liked the shower, the water is not trickling out, it is comming out with force. Another reviewer did not like the bed, I thought the bed was ok. The bed was not a 3,000 euro bed. A bed is an individual thing, some people will like it others wont. In certain spots on the bed I could feel a few springs. I would not have that bed at home, but for a few nights it is ok. Overall, I agree with this hotels high rating on Trip Advisor and recommend this hotel. If I go back to Amsterdam I will try to stay at this hotel. I have stayed at other hotels in Amsterdam including the Amrath, Radisson, Bellevue, and the Sofihotel when it was another name. Out of the four hotels I stayed at in Amsterdam I would rank the Mauro Mansion in the number one slot, followed by the Amrath. The room in the Amrath I thought was alittle small, but was still a very good hotel. I did not like the Radisson or the Bellevue and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, so friendly and close to the centre.”
Reviews.Author: Emma1990London
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just got back from a 2 night stay at Mauro Mansion, and what a lovely hotel it was. Very shabby chic and friendly. Breakfast was included and it was great. We had a room with a canal view which was lovely.. I honestly could not reccomend this hotel enough, perfect location and staff were soooo friendly! 100% would return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike_vos
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel!!! Great location, really nice and large rooms and a lovely breakfast. Stayed there a couple of times and I'm always enjoying my time..

Reviews.Title: “Not great if your room has no outside window”
Reviews.Author: cgarrett101
Reviews.Content: Perhaps this hotel receives such great ratings because it is a good value. The price is hard to beat and the rooms large and comfortable. However, I am willing to bet that very few if any of the reviewers had our room. We were on the second floor and our room had no view to the outside- just a large window looking into a small (about 10 to 12 feet in diameter) central courtyard. Due to the lights at night we had to draw the curtains, which made it very stuffy as only one small window in the wall of windows actually opened. Also, the courtyard is where guests and employees had their cigarette breaks, so the smoke rose directly into our room. Also, only the rooms with canal views are air conditioned, which I did not understand from the website. I agree the owners were nice and helpful, but the breakfast was just O.K. Two mornings we had toast and cappuccino, but one morning the cappuccino maker was broken. There was a yogurt cup one morning which we really enjoyed. I doubt we would stay there again, but the entire experience would probably have been much better in one of the outside air conditioned rooms with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Mauro deserves it's rating!”
Reviews.Author: LoisOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Mauro in late September. Other reviewers have done a great job describing the location, professionalism of the owners,the breakfasts and other details. We arrived just before 9 AM very tired after a transatlantic flight,and were told that our room would be ready 2 hours later. Welcome news! And it was. What I liked the best was the "honesty bar", the availability of great coffee all day in the common area,and the breakfast treats that Marcel prepared every day. Thank you Berry and Marcel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MindTheGap
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviews as this was an ideal place to stay. Great location and very clean hotel. I would add that the area around Mauro Mansion has a lot of bars and restaurants, too. It is very close to the red light district, but I still felt very safe. My husband and I actually found lots of great little bars within the neighborhood and had a fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: i_m_tours
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just back having spent 3 nights at the Mauro Mansion in Amsterdam and can only echo what previous reviewers have said in justifying it's No 1 rating in the city. In summary Location - excellent in it is a 3-5 min walk to the Central Station. Its proximity to the Red Light district should not put anyone off Accommodation - bedrooms are functional with an excellent bathroom. They are also spotlessly clean.. The complementary drinks in the mini-bar are a nice touch. Breakfasts - really good. They have gone for quality not quantity although there was a range of items to choose from. Hosts - helpful and friendly but not obtrusive in any way. They booked Museum tickets and made restaurant reservations for us. The only potential minor problem is if you have a room on an upper floor the stairs are very steep. However you are staying in a canal house in Amsterdam and so in many ways this just adds to the charm. All in all Mauro Mansion is an ideal place to stay if you are visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have made a better choice”
Reviews.Author: ngardens
Reviews.Content: I can only say that I agree with all of the positive reviews that have been written about Mauro Mansion. The weather turned wet and windy during our three day stay and made us really appreciate Mauro's proximity to the train station (about 2 blocks altogether) and to the many, many restaurants in the area. Our hosts were friendly and helpful with restaurant, sightseeing and travel suggestions. Our spacious room was canal side on the first (not ground) floor. There was an armoire for hanging clothing but no separate dresser, a safe, hairdryer, TV, extra pillows, extra shelf space in the bathroom for toiletries, and a mini fridge with complimentary beer, prosecco, and soft drinks. The buffet breakfast of cereals, fruit, yogurt, meats, cheeses, unique breads to toast and a small treat that differed daily (spice cake, strawberry parfait, etc.) was very satisfying. Wifi and a computer for guests to use were on the ground floor. The eclectic decorating is pleasant and funky, "boho industrial" with some antique pieces mixed in. Don't miss the masterpieces in the Rijkes and Van Gogh Museums. Take the #2 tram unless you want a long (but picturesque) walk.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Mia_Leonard
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 days touring Belgium and the Netherlands and returned yesterday. The last 4 days of this trip we spent in Amsterdam at the Mauro Mansion - this was absolutely the highlight. Marcel and Berry have made their place so comfortable, we felt at home. I was looking forward to getting to Amsterdam and staying at the Mauro Mansion based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and what I saw on Marcel and Berry's website. The decor is fabulous - its modern but comfortable. From the mix of textures - embossed wall paper, wood beams and furniture, industrial iron work, leather and rubber floors - to how clean and updated everything is. We stayed in room 34. I could live there full time! And the location is perfect! Its on quiet street but so close to the train and everything else. And the honesty bar - was beyond what I imagined. They have a large selection of wine, beer, drinks, snacks to choose from. There was no need to go out and search for such items if you didn't want to - it was all right there. Breakfast was great - nice spread with the best, fresh baked bread and Marcel made something extra every day. Thanks for the mini pancakces with fresh strawberries - I am still thinking about them! If you go make a point of taking the train to Haarlem and Zandvoort. Its an EASY day trip from Amserdam - Haarlem is 20 minutes by train and Zandvoort is about 10 minutes past Haarlem. On the last full day of our trip we took the train to Zandvoort and walked along the ocean. We then stopped at Haarlem on the way back to Amsterdam for a few hours. It was a nice way to end our vacation. I will highly recommend the Mauro Mansion!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in "The Dam"”
Reviews.Author: MisterBespoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Mauro and was thoroughly satisfied with the choice. The hotel is a 2 min walk to the train station, yet is on a quiet street next to a canal. The staff was more than helpful because we arrived 2 hours past their 9pm check-in curfew time, due to a flight delay. This is a small intimate hotel in a 1600's era canal house. The Mauro serves up a beautiful breakfast spread (included) and can also print out your tickets for all of Amsterdam's museums while you finish your morning coffee, saving you the hassle of standing in line. You can easily take a scenic walk to all of the city's major sights from the Mauro. It is also right next to the Red Light district which was a concern of mine because I didn't want to be in a seedy part of town. It wasn't a problem at all. The neighborhood is quite upscale and felt very safe, though I wouldn't recommend staying in this area with kids. The Mauro doesn't accept kids anyway. A good policy in this particular situation. The hotel owners, who work there as well, recommended a great local Italian cafe called Oggi. It takes 5 min to walk there from the Mauro and was outstanding. The manager of Oggi is Mossimo. He was wonderful and very generous to my wife and I. We ate there 3 straight nights because of him The food is terrific!! A must do for dinner if you stay at the Mauro! Try his anti-pasta appetizer. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nola R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdam where we spent 5 nights at Mauro Mansion. We would thoroughly recommend it as a clean, comfortable and well located boutique hotel where the owners cant do enough to ensure that their guests are comfortable. The location is ideal so close to the Centraal Station for tripping outside Amsterdam on trains and buses. Their attention to detail is noticable with a nice breakfast to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Calm in the City”
Reviews.Author: europeandeco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Mauro Mansion for two nights to celebrate her birthday. The hotel is clean and homely and very comfortable. It is run by two lovely guys (Berry and Marcel) who were both kind and thoughtful and paid great attention to detail, which made our trip memorable. It's situation 5 minutes from Centraal Station could not be more convenient and whilst very close to the hustle and bustle of the city, we suffered no noise or other problems. A good healthy breakfast will set you up for the day and although we did not use it, the honesty bar was very reasonably priced. Thanks guys, for a great stay. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view of the canal and close to the train station.”
Reviews.Author: NyCricket
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy walk to the central train station. This was really nice for us since we came and left by train, and during our stayed used the train several times. It is close to the red light district but the area is still nice and quiet. It was a bit of a walk to get to the museums though we enjoy walking, but if you didn't there are plenty of public transportation options. The hotel was very comfortable; they have a simple breakfast every morning, and a coffee machine that you can use anytime. Berry and Marcel were quiet but extremely helpful when we asked them questions. They will buy museum tickets for you online or make reservations. This was great to avoid the lines at the very busy museums. The stairs to the rooms are tight and winding and while we were checking in they had carried our heavy luggage up to our room for us. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and clean. There was a beautiful vase of flowers and a mini refrigerator in the room with several complimentary drinks. There was a safe in the closet, but there was no luggage rack. Our room had a lovely view of the canal, but did get very warm from the morning sun coming in. They did have an air conditioning unit in the room. We did make the mistake of opening the large windows to let some air in....we did not realize the error of this until that night when my friend was bitten in several places on her face. That was bad but after that incident we kept the windows closed and that took care of the problem. This was a good hotel and I would recommended staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to visit Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: carlago54
Reviews.Content: Once arrived in Amsterdam you can travel from Schiphol to the Central Sttion in 10 minutes. Other 5 minutes walking (not more than 300 meters) and you can find Mauro Mansion, a botique hotel overlooking the Geldersekade canal in the Nieuwmarkt area. Fantastic. Owned by Berry and Marcel the hotel is perfectly organized and allows an unforgettably stay in the historic center of the city. Our room was the #23, one of the Courtyard rooms; very clean, silent we had wonderful nights of sleep in this modern room. In the morning Marcel pampered us with delicious breakfasts. Again I have to thank Tripadvisor that allowed me to discover another jewel: Mauro Mansion

Reviews.Title: “So Glad We Stayed There!”
Reviews.Author: Grmpmbl
Reviews.Content: Marcel and Berry are wonderful hosts. They somehow manage to be helpful and caring (they help carry luggage up and down the stairs!) without being at all intrusive. The location is perfect--we walked everywhere--and despite being on the edge of the Red Light District, the hotel is an oasis in a very busy city. The breakfast is wonderful: hot, fresh breads; platters of cheeses and meats (along with containers of yogurt and other accompaniments in a lovely red refrigerator!); coffees/espresso; and, every day, a special "side" treat prepared by Marcel. One morning, he prepared skewers of fresh, mini pancakes alternating with strawberries; another morning, rolled pancakes; yet another, a cup of fresh fruit with yogurt. We stayed in one of the front rooms facing the canal (on the first floor--what in the US would be the second floor), and while I might wish for some small, fold-out luggage racks, we loved our room--very whimsically designed, with a comfortable bed and welcome beverages in the mini fridge. While there is free WiFi, the signal is often a bit weak, or at least it was in our room. (We might warn everyone, though, about mosquitoes. That's not a criticism of the hotel, but a fact related to Amsterdam's canals. Use the air conditioning rather than opening the window.) Berry and Marcel were very knowledgeable and helpful about restaurants (we took their advice), and when my husband contracted a cold, Berry knew to direct me to the nearest pharmacy and also helped me decide on where to get a gift for the business associate I would be visiting. (The young man who assists Berry and Marcel at the desk is also very nice and helpful.) When we go back to Amsterdam, we will try to book far enough in advance to be able to stay here again. This place was perfect for our combination vacation/business trip. Thank you yet again, Berry and Marcel.

Reviews.Title: “First stay in Amsterdam, excellent choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLAJD
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location for all the main places too see, five minutes walk from the train station. Excellent hosts in an excellent establishment, lovely breakfast in the morning and happy to share local knowledge as we wanted to eat in local traditional Dutch restaurants. We would stop at Mauro Mansion again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bobsx3
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Mauro Mansion for 2 nights and absolutely loved it. It was priced at the higher end of our budget but was definitely worth it. It was actually great value. We only wish we could have stayed longer! Pros: Extremely accommodating and helpful hosts; clean, comfortable and beautifully designed room; Central location close to major sites and transport; breakfast; complimentary items in the mini bar Cons: nil

Reviews.Title: “Mauro Mansion is marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: hockeymom89
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to stay at Mauro Mansion. The location is terrific with truly a short 5 minute walk from Amsterdam central. It is most convenient for sightseeing as well. We were welcomed by Arped who although new to the staff was very friendly and helpful. Marcel and Barry provide wonderful little touches like fresh flowers in the rooms as well as in the breakfast area. We had a canal view room and were able to sit at the small table and chairs. We enjoyed the complimentary prosecco provided upon our welcome and watch the swans on the canal! The rooms were well appointed and very clean. Mauro Mansion will definitely be our first choice when we return to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “We join the songs of praise”
Reviews.Author: AJ&ERtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August, one of those miserable week's of rain and cool temperatures. The hotel cheered us up. I'm guessing we had the best room in the place, the one on the left, ground floor, as you enter the hotel. It was large and had all the amenities including a mosquito net. The exposed, original brick wall was a decor delight. The mini bar with complimentary contents was a small touch reflecting the care and consideration of the management. We found Marcel and Berry to be exceptional hosts providing intelligence on everything from where to go, where to eat and what to see. The breakfast was exactly what we wanted, a kind of mini buffet where you might have a little toast, some yoghurt, pretty much the kind of things we might normally eat. We found the honour bar quite useful. A bottle of red wine allowed us a glass each evening before setting out to explore. I didn't know they had mosquitoes in Amsterdam but, with all the rain, they were out in force. We did actually have to sleep under the mosquito net. It was rather fun since years ago I lived in the Caribbean. It brought back fond memories. A couple of minor points. We arrived at the train station in torrential rain that was clearly not going to stop. We had seven weeks travel luggage with us so there was no way we could walk the six hundred meters to the hotel. But no cab driver would take us - the distance was too short. I finally sat down in a puddle and burst into tears until a sympathetic driver took pity on us. The road the hotel is on is not so quiet, it is quite busy. This is only a concern when walking towards the city centre. Be very aware of cars, trucks and, most of all, cyclists. The hotel is on the verge of the red light district which is a bit of a hoot. Walking through at night is a must in terms of people watching and general interest. But you have to walk through it most of the time to get to the main square. My wife, the most broadminded of ladies, eventually found the scene a bit tiresome. Asking her why, she replied that it was all rather sad and that visits to a city should be happy. An interesting point. In summary then, a lovely hotel, wonderful hosts and an enjoyable visit. Thank you Marcel and Berry.

Reviews.Title: “Any time again”
Reviews.Author: Nagtie
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our short stay. We particularly chose the place from Tripadvisor and it has not disappointed at all. It's very personal, intimate, relaxed and just cozy. The rooms are obviously not large, but come with all amenities. TV & DVD player (DVDs can be borrowed from the 'living room') and even a complimentary minibar. The hosts are very helpful and friendly and the location is excellent. Don't need more. Parking is an issue for anyone arriving by car. We parked on a public parking nearby and they wanted to charge Euro 120 per night. That was the only challenge and it surely isn't the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Its really a good Hotel and Hosts are very much helpful and kind for everything.”
Reviews.Author: Nipun_world
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Amsterdam , first of all I would like to say ,After traveling a lot I found Amsterdam is a wonderful, beautiful , live and amazing city of world . My first choice shifted to Amsterdam from Goa of India . For this type of city you must stay at a good location and this Hotel is at a good location as you can reach here by walking from station and taxi also can reach to Hotel . One Indian restaurant is also apposite the Hotel after crossing the canal . Everything said in views are exactly right . Just one thing I would like to say here that if you wants to stay at a tourist and crowded live place of Amsterdam centre very near to Dam Square , where you can enjoy every moment of live Amsterdam than you can stay in Luxer Hotel or many many small hotels are there on the same street which is always full of tourists and bars and restaurants from morning to night up to 3 o clock . Just came out from Hotel door and amazing life amazing night , laughing , drinking , eating crowd of tourists of all over world is there to welcome you . For Asians and Indians much better to stay near of in Luxer Hotel and for Europeans Mauro Mansion is better as it is at a calm and quiet place with much comfortable rooms .

Reviews.Title: “STAY here!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel887
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and WOW! The rooms are the best ive stayed in, modern deco, large tv, beds sooo comfy! Owners are helpful and lovely. Location great too I really don't think you'll find a better place to stay in Amsterdam, we'll defo be back! Thanks Mauro

Reviews.Title: “Stately Building housing 2 Thoughtful Owners and Gorgeous Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wOoDpEkEr
Reviews.Content: Reservations were simple and easy, Berry & Marcel respond to emails real fast and provide very precise instructions on the way to get there. Using landmarks as guides to the hotel is really good idea since there are so many streets and alleys. Then again, Mauro Mansion is right by the canal so it's relatively easy to get to. Situated stone throw from the Red Light District(2mins walk if fast-walker), it's surprisingly quiet at night, and the immediate surrounding area seems to be residential and some rented apartments. So the neighbours are safe enough! Marcel was accomodating to my request for earlier check-in at 840(thanks) and when my room is ready, luggage is automatically put into a cage-like clothes rack in the room. Having said that, the rack was probably designed with mainly Dutch in mind(notice they are really tall?). Being 168cm myself, had to stretch abit to hang clothes. Tea and coffee in abundance, complete with creamer and sugar, but the water pot was totally mouldy, and didn't dare use it, couldn't bother to wash it thoroughly. 3 levels of rooms, and staying in room 32, it was peaceful enough(with only 4 other rooms around me) but the sound-proofing is near nonexistent cos it's very clear what the activities and conversation topics were outside my door. Having said that, it didn't happen often, probably thrice in a day(since was out almost the whole day). The decor of the room and the little touches were probably what made this property stand out among the rest. Clad in red, with interesting drawings adorn the wall, a cafe style table + chairs set beside the window overlooking the peaceful canal with swans and geese keeping company. Rate includes two soft drinks, two juices, two beers and two proseccos with flute. Sweet for a canal view room and comes in handy when u just wanna relax with your partner or just appreciate the beauty of Amsterdam. A book "The UnDutchables" was in the cupboard should you want to know more about the culture, arts and the norms of Amsterdam society, good for those with some time to spare and a relatively long stay in the city, an check out their collection of novels stacked on the shelf. Welcome chocolates on the pillow adds another surprise. Bed is comfortable and big(queen sized) with seperate duvets, quality is not the "Dream Bed" kind like HIlton's, but good enough, and unless you're a Sleep Connoiseur, it's good enough to rest after a day of exploring. Wifi is provided free but signal is suspect at times. Then again, I am on the 3rd level, so. In the welcome letter, states they are huge on recycling and green efforts, but I suppose it will be good if they can provide another trashcan to contain the gass/plastic/paper waste we produce since the hotel encourages this segregation. I had to leave my plastics and glass on the table since there's only one can in the room. Toilet, as the room is, can be termed 'large' by European standards, with underfloor heating(useful in Amsterdam's weather) but smells abit when it's heated. Comes with good choice of bath gels and shampoo. No toothbrush so b-y-o. Bathtub with showerhead, sufficiently large to squeeze in two, but it appears to be quiteworn, so didn't try to do a bath. Water pressure quite weak(lvl 3, reason perhaps?) and takes some use to for the adjustments of hot/cold water. Once you got it, it's fine. Provides hand wash gel, very convenient instead of using soap. Breakfast is sufficient, bread loaves, cold cut meats(x3 kinds), fromage (x6), yoghurts, butter, spreads, coffee/tea are all available, and Marcel brings out fruit yoghurt for everyone. For someone who doesn't like yoghurt, this is something special and is full of fruity burst goodness in every bite! Dunt reject this! In the breakfast room, there's also the 'Honesty Bar'; choose what you want and let them know at checkout or whenever you want to. Not sure if they know should you not report it, but I never tried. Eur6 for a prosecco/white wine, Eur 2 for bit bag snacks and beer is not exorbitant and quite good value pricing for a hotel. Nearby are plenty of eateries, but none stay open till 12, so should you require a proper bite, walk alittle deeper into the RLD and you can find all the kebabs and Shoamar you need. 5 minutes walk to the Centraal station, 7 to the Damrak. They can keep your luggage should you require this service after you checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hosts and amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Louis R
Reviews.Content: Marcel & Berry and two amazing hosts. They welcome at their place you as if you were a friend. The breakfast is really amazing, fresh, with fruits, cheese and everything you would like ! I will be back for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: mcowan32
Reviews.Content: Hard to know what to add - much deserved praise has already been lavished on this small, discreet and comfortable hotel, in a superb canal-side location a short and easy walk from the main railway station (hence also ideal for tram/bus/metro/ferry). Berry and Marcel (ably assisted by young RP from Hungary) were helpful, efficient and (important for us over-60's) extremely computer-savvy. Must also mention Marcel's delicious and varied treats at breakfast each morning! The coffee machine was much used - a bit scary at first, but it produced excellent cappuccino and caffelatte at all hours. We got used to the steep stairs - no problem even with a heavy case. Stylish room, with canopy bed and a surreal rocking chair, overlooking canal (minimal noise but worth taking ear plugs if you are a light sleeper), and a copy of Munch's "The Scream" to greet anyone daring to ascend the metal ladder(!). Wide choice of music/film on CD/DVD available to guests -good to hear Adele as well as Sarah Vaughan etc. We'd love to return when next in Amsterdam, but I suspect we'd need to book well in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to experience old Amsterdam from!”
Reviews.Author: Webbedfeet
Reviews.Content: Literally a quick walk from the train station (you don't need a cab unless you're hauling steamer trunks - which to be clear I don't travel lightly and I didn't mind the walk at all!) From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, Marcel and Berry were the perfect hosts. We often read the welcome guest information package and I was delighted that they included a statement about their important relationship with their LOCAL suppliers (it truly is what builds a strong community) - in addition to that a statement was made about the simple but very nutritious breakfast they provided and this is where if you pay attention to the fine details you will be surprised every morning at breakfast by some creation Marcel has put together to add to what you've already chosen (I'll leave it as a surprise because no two days were the same for us) Our room was #23 - absolutely immaculate and the deep tub was to die for after a day out walking about. (see my review of Sandeman's walking tours - the perfect start for your stay) If you're looking to experience all that was and is Amsterdam - this is the place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Jinglis-59
Reviews.Content: I booked Mauro based on the excellent Trip Advisor reviews, and although it is a lovely place to stay it didn't quite live up to expectations. It's definitely unique... in a good way! And I agree with a previous reviewer that it's more a boutique B&B rather than a hotel, but that's a positive in my book and makes it more appealing. It has a lot going for it... The location is superb - 5 mins walk from the train station and a very central starting point for whatever you want to see and do. The room we had was on tlhe first floor and faced the canal; it was spacious with a high ceilling, uniquely decorated and furnished, and had a great view. A kettle is provided with a selection of teas and coffee, and there's also a mini fridge in the room which was stocked with complimentary drinks. The little treat on our pillow each day was a really nice touch. The breakfast room is lovely, as was the breakfast... great selection of breads, peanut butter, jams, chocolate sprinkles etc., cold meats and cheeses, cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit, juices, teas and coffee, (although if you like your tea made with boiling water you'll be disappointed!) The 'honesty bar' is a great idea - whether you use it or not, it's nice to know it's there. The not so good points are: The pillows are too high and hard - ok if you like sleeping with your head at right-angles to your body! The mattresses are very uncomfortable - you can feel the springs coming through! It was a bit strange having 2 single quilts over a double bed, but I guess that's because we had 2 single beds pushed together! If you sleep with the window open it's very noisy - although you can keep the window shut and put the aircon on (our choice not to do that!) There's a ridiculous net canopy above the bed... what's the point? It just gets in the way and gathers dust! All in all, is it value for money? Probably not - it's quite an expensive and you could find a perfectly good hotel for much less. However..... Would I stay there again?.... Most definitely! And would I recommend it to others?..... Absolutely yes!

Reviews.Title: “Hell Yes!”
Reviews.Author: mike9mc
Reviews.Content: This place definitely earns it's #1 rating on Tripadvisor! Marcel and Berry are amazing hosts. They can provided you with great advice on what to do. Skip the line tickets are a must and they will provide them for you. The room was great. We've stayed at a lot of places and this rates with the best of them! Stay here! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Quiet Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: katie5199
Reviews.Content: Quiet, very clean, very comfortable, contemporary, convenient location, fantastic breakfast (great coffee and fresh baked goodies), perfect-sized room, fantastic toiletries, radiant heated bathroom floors (great in the winter) close to great restaurants, wonderful owners (kind and hardworking) ... I could go on and on. I love the quote that is nicely placed on the wall of the breakfast area, "Love, Be Passionate, Be Spontaneous, Dream Big, Celebrate, Change the World" ... it's very nice touch to the decor and also seems to be a reflection on the type of atmosphere that this hotel creates. This really is the perfect hotel for a quiet, romantic honeymoon or simply a special getaway.

Reviews.Title: “An Eclectic hotel”
Reviews.Author: smallface1
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual hotel well located in a delightful city. my only drawback is the quality of the beds which could be better but still highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: d0raim0n
Reviews.Content: My BF and I stayed at Mauro Mansion for a few nights and we loved every minute of it. The hotel location is perfect for seeing the touristy sites as well as the local neighborhoods. It's difficult to call this hotel a "hotel" as it is more like a B&B. The owners are very friendly and available to help provide guidance tourist locations/directions as well as recommendations on excellent restaurants in the area. We had a street-level room and it turned out to be much better than we expected. The bed is comfortable and the room is spacious and beautifully decorated. We also loved the welcome bottle of Prosecco. The honesty bar is a fantastic idea and it gave us the feeling that we were more like "house guests" than hotel customers. We looked forward to the daily breakfast in the dining area--the food was delicious. If we ever make it back to Amsterdam, we will definitely stay at Mauro Mansion again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: RisingZen
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 night stay in Amsterdam and we were very glad we chose this hotel. Mauro Mansion is a small (they only have 9 rooms) couple led hotel around the corner from red light district and central station. Pros: - Personal service from Mercel & Berry. They are an excellent example of how a good service can push the hotel up another level. Mercel greeted us at the door when we checked in. Although we arrived early we were able to check in. Whilst the room was getting ready, Mercel made us a cup of coffee (from Jura coffee machine!) and asked if we wanted any help with sight seeing. Berry left different treats (chocolate, waffle etc) on the pillow everyday as he cleaned the room. Someone was always at the reception and would welcome us with a smile etc. - Location is very convenient if you wanted to be near the red light district or the central station. We booked a canal view and were not disappointed with the excellent view. The street was not sleazy or too noisy despite its proximity to the red light district (ok, there was a prostitute's window down the same street but this hardly bothered us or anyone in the hotel). - Room was spacious and bathroom well appointed with power shower. The decoration was done in an ultra modern fashion and may divide the opinion - we liked it. It also has air con to keep the room cool. - The fridge was stocked with free goodies as a compliment e.g. beers, juice and even a small bottle of proseco. They weren't restocked (as it was explained) but we were free to use the fridge. - Wifi worked well and a laptop was provided, again free of charge - The honesty bar was very reasonably priced (for Amsterdam). - I wasn't sure about the breakfast at the beginning as it was limited (x3 choices of ham, x2 choice of cheese, 2 types of breads and cereals, orange or apple juice, coffee & tea, fruits) and no hot food or salads. But Mercel made different additional food every day (pancake on the first day, pinapple on another day, apple tart etc) and we were interested to see what next day brings. We also realized we didn't really want a heavy breakfast as the dutch restaurants tended to serve late and we were too full the next day. Cons: - Our room's window didn't open (we thought we can see the next room's open) - Although trams were near by, it was a little inconvenient if majority of the site seeing were in museum, central or western area. Not a huge negative for us as we liked walking through the red light district as we came back to people watch. - As it was a small place a one unthoughtful family can make the place uncomfortable. We were unfortunate to see a family from non-euopean "english" speaking country occupy 2 tables and a sofa between 3 of them when everyone else were sharing a table between 2 people. They also hogged the communal laptop and we could not get near it at breakfast or evening time. - The soundproofing was much much better than in british hotel. But on occasion we could hear street noise. We also had a infrequent low buzzing noise coming from inside of the room lasting 1-2 seconds. - There were mosquitoes in the room but this is unavoidable being next to the canal. Mozzy net is provided so not a huge problem. - the stairs are very steep and not for anyone with physical disability. I think there were x2 ground floor rooms though. Overall I would recommend the hotel to anyone that's not easily offended by the near by red light district and not in need of a more quiet sedate canals in less touristy parts of the Amsterdam. It suited us well and would be happy to go back if we go back to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “In the Red Light District, but not in the Red Light District. Simply Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cwil99
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion is technically in the Red Light District. But kind of like how Staten Island is technically part of New York City. Sure, it can make this claim, but it's far enough away to not have to deal with everything negative about the district. It is located on a quiant street. Very quiet, away from any crowds. Our rooms were their very own. Each room was setup differently and had their own charm. The rooms were clean and the caretakers/owners (I can't remember their names now), couldn't be more helpful. The complimentary breakfast in their little kitchen was out of this world. We spent each morning recounting our Amsterdam experiences and planning what we were going to do that day. The two owners were always there and ready to help and serve. It's no accident this hotel is ranked NUMBER ONE in Amsterdam. It should be! (by the way, it's more of a bed and breakfast than an actual hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: CureGourmande
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion is located in the Central Station area, near to the city center. Rooms with fancy design (Courtyard room : with barber chair and whirlpool), spacious and clean! TV with DVD player and several DVDs available in the lounge on the ground floor. Charming welcome by the hosts; tasty quality-breakfast ; coffee-to-go available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbwilletslp
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion is a darling, tiny hotel in the heart of Amsterdam. It was so easy to get around and walk to most of our to do list. The staff was extremely helpful with suggestions, reservations, sights,n planning for the weather, etc. They made our visit memorable. Best breakfast anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but not super friendly”
Reviews.Author: 26West
Reviews.Content: Everything everyone has raved about is true: super clean, nice location, honor bar, mini bar stocked with drinks, tea kettle in room, fresh flowers on nightstand, nice breakfast, funky decor, luggage transported up and down the stairs, etc. BUT.... I found Berry and Marcel more formal than friendly. Maybe it was just my perception and I don't view it as a negative, but I was expecting something different. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it without hesitation to all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuolus place and great owners”
Reviews.Author: Leefini
