Reviews.Content: We loved our time at mauromansion...the room was magic and quiet.location excellent and the breakfasts to die for..we love healthy food breads and juices..all provided generously and with a sensible time for breakfast 9 to 11 and for stragglers like us you could still be eating nearer noon. As for the honesty bar! Such consideration.they also advised us of some divine eating places such as lastage, on the other side of our canal.DEserves to be number 1 in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Global_Nomadista
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mauro Mansion for one night. The room was basic and clean, I was a bit underwhelmed because of the super glowing reviews... it reminded us of the Ace Hotel, which is a budget, cool, funky place. This is more expensive than the Ace so I would really expect a bit more for the price... but anyway, the issue that came up was that we were awoken at 8 am by extremely loud construction near our window. They deducted half off our bill for this - that was appreciated and helped make up for it - I consider that good customer service. They also carried our bags up and down the stairs, which we were grateful for. Lastly, the breakfast was also underwhelming - I eat mostly organic and healthy food, and the yogurts were all the 'sugary' kind, no plain yogurt, and the fruit selection could have been better. Great, fresh bread was a nice touch. Overall, not bad, as long as you don't have the construction next door (not their fault!).

Reviews.Title: “it's the little things that make all the difference, and this hotel had thought of them all.”
Reviews.Author: kerry_mcinally
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for our 10th wedding Anniversary after reading previous reviews on trip advisor. We arrived at about 3p.m and were greeted by one of the hotel owners Berry, who showed us into a gorgeous living area. He was lovely shook our hands and gave us a very warm welcome, he offered us a map to the city and gave us a quick rundown on where we were on the map in relation to places of interest, asked us if we had any plans, and offered to book our tickets for us on line. He then showed us to our room and carried our luggage up the winding stairs. Our room was beautiful, high ceilings, a beautiful canopy above the bed, very stylishly furnished, fresh flowers near the window, a complimentary mini bar, tea and coffee etc. Breakfast the next morning was in the living room, it was very relaxed, Marcel and Berry's philosophy in quality not quantity, warm bread, cooked meats and sliced cheese, fresh fruit and juice, and extremely good coffee, along with a surprise daily. It was all delicious. There was free internet access, they would print things off for you if you asked, there was a phone at the front desk so you could call them if you needed them, umbrella's for you to borrow, DVD's to borrow, reading material. An honesty bar filled with wines selected through wine tastings. It really was just perfect. The hotel itself is located about 10 minutes walk away from the central train station, and the furthest we walked to anything was about 20 minutes away, we had two very nice meals at the hard rock cafe, and a place called CAU near to Dam square. The icing on the cake however was the day of our 10th wedding anniversary, we arrived back at our hotel to find freshly cut roses, two glasses and a bottle of champagne with a note to say congratulations on 10 years. If there was nothing else to see Amsterdam I would return just to stay at the Mauro Mansion, I felt so relaxed and much of that was down to our hosts, everything seemed effortless yet it was obviously that every effort had been made to make our stay a very enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate bread and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jimfink
Reviews.Content: As you walk in through the front door you are greeted warmly and enter the common area and breakfast room. There is a cooler with bottles of wine, beer, water and such at quite reasonable prices that you can access any time on the honor system. Rooms are roomy, unique and fun. Be aware that the stairs are narrow spirals in the Dutch tradition, but the proprietors are quite helpful getting bags to the room. Great amenities including the complimentary proseco, beer and drinks in the room. The breads at breakfast were wonderful. A unique and wonderful travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Mauro Mansion”
Reviews.Author: bkelley77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon in early April 2011. Loved the place. Welcoming and kind hosts, quirky and fun rooms, yummy breakfast, nice location, just wonderful. I'd absolutely stay here again and will tell anyone I know visiting Amsterdam to stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: SUGARPLUM8
Reviews.Content: Thank you Berry & Marcel - your hotel is lovely. The hospitality, rooms, breakfast, location all top class. We felt at home straight away and knew we could get any help and assistance if we needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a centuries old canal house with modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: Denndy
Reviews.Content: Our hosts couldn't have been nicer although it was kind of a pain to wait until 9:00 a.m. to get into the building since our flight from Boston arrived quite early. The stairs up are quite steep but we managed OK. It is a short walk from the commuter rail station but watch out of the bikes and cars and take it slowly over the cobblestones. Many restaurants are close by and most sights in the city are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Nicinici
Reviews.Content: Booked mauro mansion on-line based on it's review in TA and the stay did not disappoint us. It is easy to book on-line and the hosts are very helpful. Breakfast is simple but fresh and healthy. Love the free mini bar in room and the honesty bar. A Mac book is free for use and you can find many travel resources, including guide books in reception. Also love the music they played, wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: reluctant33
Reviews.Content: NIce place to stay in good location. Breakfasts could be a lot better. Rooms were nice. Owners were very helpful. Enjoyed but not sure it deserves #1 ranking. Would stay there again more for the convenient location and decent accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room on quiet street near all the action!!!”
Reviews.Author: alanwmoore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the Mauro. We arrived at the Amsterdam HBF and easily walked the 10 minutes to the hotel. A very nice quiet street on a canal. The staff and hotel were exactly as all the other reviews state! We had a great room overlooking the street and the canal. We were several streets over from the center of the action, just close enough to get there quickly but far enough to not have all the crowds. Our room was HUGE! The owners were very thoughtful, laying a rose-petal heart on our bed and providing champagne for our anniversary! The huge windows even opened up! Breakfast was wonderful too. There was nothing at all bad to say about this hotel, it was absolutely amazing and a perfect home base to explore all Amsterdam has to offer. Book it, you won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Delight for some Kiwis a long way from home”
Reviews.Author: GN&YS
Reviews.Content: Besides ourselves we had organised to meet up with two other NZ couples in Amsterdam and we booked the Mauro for the 6 of us hoping that it would be as good as what we had read about the place. Well it WAS and more.Excellent value for money. Berry and Marcel are excellent hosts, always ready to help with information and suggestions, and the location of the Mauro could not be better especially for first timers to Amsterdam. It really is only an easy 10 min walk from the central station. The rooms are a good size, clean, comfortable and well appointed. It was a really nice touch to have a small fridge in each of the rooms with some complimentary drinks inside. The honesty bar downstairs was also a very good idea and the prices were very reasonable. Breakfast each day was an experience with some sort of surprise arriving on the table each morning.The food selection was perfectly adequate for all our needs and the coffee machine worked just great. As we 3 couples all left to go on our river cruise which by the way was conveniently only a 10 minute stroll from the Mauro to the ship we all agreed that the Mauro was a great place to stay. Next time any of us visit Amsterdam the consensus of opinion was that we would certainly go back there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Everything”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoFLTravelers
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Mauro Mansion and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is in a fantastic location. It is very close to the train station and right on a canal. There are also many restaurants very near. Our room, which was on the third floor, faced the canal and had a lovely and memorable view. The room was large and very clean and fresh. The bathroom was modern and again very clean. The bed was comfortable and it was nice to have a refrigerator in the room. The free WiFi was also greatly appreciated, as was the large flat screen TV and DVD player (a large selection of DVDs is available for use). Owners Berry and Marcel were wonderful hosts. They offered excellent restaurant suggestions as well as other very helpful information about touring the city and environs. Breakfast was great every morning with special little touches like fresh melon, strawberries and pineapple. This is a very charming and unique hotel. We would recommend it to anyone and we would stay there again in a heartbeat when we are in Amsterdam the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mauro Magic”
Reviews.Author: Tangels10
Reviews.Content: This place is sensational if your looking for a quiet, very convenient location, great hosts and lots of character. It is a boutique hotel with some very interesting features. Basic, modern, minimalist - but stylish. Free WiFi in room or Mac in the lounge - great

Reviews.Title: “Great City B&B”
Reviews.Author: rubyann328
Reviews.Content: This B&B is just wonderfully located near the main train station and on the canal. Walking distance to most of the attractions. Each of the 9 rooms are an original. We stayed there for 4 nights with our teenage kids. Marcel and Berry were extremely helpful and friendly in planning our activities. Red light district around the corner provided interesting evening strolls with the kids but no problems. Would definitely recommend this place to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mauro Mansion's during Xmas and the owners are super nice and thoughtful. They offered us help pre our arrival to make restaurant bookings etc for us. How nice.. and also every morning they had a unique daily touch to the breakfast! The rooms were lovely and they had floor heating in the bathroom! What a luxury! It felt like we were guests of our friends! They made us feel at home! Would def return! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: agyjay
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights over the Easter holiday at Mauro Mansion. Easy to get to from the train station and we were greeted by Berry with coffee and tea and a warm welcome. Our room was not ready but we could leave our bags, have some breakfast, and freshen up before we headed out to explore Amsterdam. Our room on the third floor overlooking the canal was great...swans swimming in the canal when I woke up the first morning! Breakfast was a treat...something special every day and the bread was wonderful. An amazing coffee machine that made the best cappucino. We were especially grateful for the tips and information provided by Berry and Marcel....when to visit the museums and getting us our tickets online to avoid the crowds was much appreciated. The drinks in the room refrigerator made a nice treat. We had no problem with the walk up to the third floor, but that might be a consideration for some. Staying at the Mauro Mansion was the perfect spot to explore all of Amsterdam and it made our trip so special. Thanks again to Berry and Marcel for all your suggestions, help, and hospitality !

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: MymyaTodmorden
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy staying in places with history and charm you'll love this place. Our room is on the second floor at the front of the house overlooking the canal - I'm looking out of the two huge windows as I write this. Perfectly placed for the train station and surrounded by restaurants and bars - perfect for business (my husband!) and leisure...me!! Our room is well equipped and comforable. Breakfast is served in a charming room and the free drinks in our mini fridge are much appreciated. Berry has been very helpful giving us a map, orientating us and recommending places to eat. It's little touches like DVD's to borrow, an honesty bar downstairs, umbrellas which can be borrowed, chocolates on your pillow when you arrive, etc. that make this place special. I would heartily recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “FantÃ¡stico!!!”
Reviews.Author: Quitet08
Reviews.Content: We had a enjoyable stay at Mauro's. The treat was fantastic and the room tidy and cute. A cosy atmosphere close to the lively center. If we have to come back to Amsterdam this is our place to stay. A good coffee for free is always available for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our 3 week honeymoon in Europe”
Reviews.Author: jkcg
Reviews.Content: After our flight(s) from Chicago, and train ride from the airport to the Central Station, we arrived to a very busy Amsterdam. Thankfully, it was only a short walk to the hotel. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Berry. We immediately felt welcomed; the atmosphere & feel of the hotel was very relaxed. The room was cool... decorated with an old-school barber chair, a desk with a chair, a flat screen TV, and a canopy netting over the bed. The bathroom was great! (We were a little worried about the room sizes/bathrooms heading to Europe, but we were 1 for 1 with this place) Also, rose petals on the bed, a small bottle of wine, and a postcard signed by both Berry & Marcel, were really loved by my wife, and was just one example of the attention they seemed to give all of their guests. This coupled with the awesome breakfast (including home made crepes one morning), really make this place feel like a bed & breakfast, which we really enjoyed! The location was perfect. It was close to the Central Station, right around the corner from the Red Light District, yet on a quiet street across from a canal, that was nice to come home to every night after running around all day. The hotel was very clean & very secure, which was definitely important coming to another country. Another thing that made this trip to Amsterdam awesome, were the recommendations coming from Berry & Marcel. The places they suggested for lunch & dinner were PERFECT! So, I would highly recommend this hotel. The #1 ranking is definitely justified. We spent 3 nights in Amsterdam, which seemed like enough, however, we would have loved to stay longer, and would definitely stay again if we ever return, in the Mauro Mansion. Thanks Berry & Marcel! Jeff & Casey

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind.”
Reviews.Author: JMartW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Europe. We stayed 4 nights in Amsterdam at the Mauro Mansion. I decided to book the hotel after reading all of the great comments on trip advisor. I can't imagine there being any better place to stay in Amsterdam. It feels more like staying at a friends house then staying in a hotel. They have a good selection of nutritious breakfast items to choose from in the mornings. The hotel is in a great location that is close to everything but on a quiet street. There are several good places to eat close by. They put yummy chocolates on your pillow everyday. They also stock the fridge in your room with several drinks that are there as your welcome gifts. We stayed in one of the rooms at the front next to the canal and it was very quiet. No problems with noise at all. Barry and Marcel are very friendly and always seem happy to answer any questions. Absolutely loved staying here and will definitely stay again the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KarenatHastings
Reviews.Content: Hotel is five minutes walk from Amsterdam Centraal (look out for the pushbikes!) and tram and metro stops. Very warm greeting from owners. Our room was clean, quirky with a lovely view of one of the many canals. Complementary mini bar (not re-stocked)was a bonus and we loved drinking our bottle of Prosecco looking out on the canal one night. Breakfast was between 9.00 and 11.00, although they were happy to accommodate us at 8.00am one morning when we wanted an earlier start. They were also happy to recommend a restaurant for us and managed to reserve us a table during a very busy period, which we don't think we could have done ourselves. Would not hesitate in booking again.

Reviews.Title: “a small planet in a big city”
Reviews.Author: nikandeli
Reviews.Content: everything was perfect : very close to the station, small and lovely hotel, very clean, good breakfast, nice rooms, perfect destination so you can start with your discovery and not to forget the owners : lovely, helpful, funny, had good conversations in the evening and morning...my hotel in amsterdam for my next visits.....

Reviews.Title: “I felt like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: trallala27
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in Amsterdam in Mauros Mansion, so it's the first time I feel the need to write somthing about the hotel. Lovely, friendly persons, very clean rooms and really good service. Every morning something special for breakfast, good coffee for different tasts. Different drinks in the room for free, also there was the posibility of boiling water and have coffee and tee in the room. If I ever go to Amsterdam again, I know where to stay. Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'll never forget those days at Mauros Mansion......................................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “More of a B&B Than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrJoelB
Reviews.Content: Located in a Canal House a few blocks from Central Station this small establishment is more of a B&B than a hotel. The owners are very gracious and helpful. The rooms are large and comfortable. Since we visited in the winter, the heated towel rack and heated bathroom floor tiles were much appreciated. Location is great. If you prefer a big hotel experience this is probably not the place for you, but if you want something small and welcoming, you will like Mauro Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: rzte1106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mauro Mansion for 2 nights. Both of us loved this place. We did not have a canal facing room. I think we had one of the smaller rooms compared to others and I thought our room was big, spacious and clean. The bathroom is huge with heated tile floor and jet tub. The bed was comfortable. We loved our room, felt at home and got the best nights sleep. Everything seems new, crisp and clean. Having never been to Amsterdam, I was a little worried about the location being so close to the train station and the Red light disctrict. Let me reassure you. The location is perfectly fine. We walked, with luggage to MM from the train station without any problems. There is free wi-fi, movies to watch in your room, and a community computer in the lobby. Breakfast is great. Wonderful breads and spreads. Sliced meats, cheeses, yogurts and fruit. The tea and coffee is even fabulous. I felt like they used high quality foods and beverages. I even like the music they played during breakfast. The owners are wonderful. I can't say enough about MM. I would stay here again and recommend this place to everyone. As a sidenote. Steven's a bar/cafe down the street had to-die for sandwhiches. Perfect place for lunch and a beer.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: OstendTraveller
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights in Mauro Mansion in Amsterdam with my wife and we were very pleasantly surprised. Perfectly located in the city centre (very close to the Central rail station), it is a welcome change from the big hotel chains that all look the same. Here, your really feel like your on a special trip. it makes you want to stay longer (or come back soon)!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: jacobwjs
Reviews.Content: I never typically take the time to write reviews, but my stay at the Mauro Mansion was probably one of my best hotel experiences. We spent roughly 2 weeks here, with a portion used as our "base station" when we traveled to a few other cities. I have to say hotels in Paris and in Rome didn't match everything that we got here. It's just done right. The little details are taken care of and thought about. It's how a hotel should be, but somehow people forgot or it got lost with the larger chains. If you're looking for a loud party zone, or stuffy 5 star atmosphere this isn't the place, but if you cherish just the right amount of extravagance mixed with comfort and amazing hosts this is the spot. No really.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and perfect ambiance”
Reviews.Author: jbr12
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Mauro Mansion. Being a regular visitor to Amsterdam over the years I was excited to see the Tripadvisor reviews on this place and it certainly lived up to expectations. Berry and Marcel were lovely hosts, we both loved the fact the service was always there, but was very unobtrusive. Our room was on the first floor with a view onto the canal. it was spacious, comfortable and, for a street facing room, pretty quiet. The bed was comfortable and we slept well for our 3 nights there. Our only niggle was the mosquito net over the bed - it was impossible to tie back fully and kept falling onto us when we were chilling out watching TV. But that's it - the only niggle - hardly major. It's location not far from the train station means there is a little noise from the trains, but not enough to disturb. The location is spot on - just a short stroll from the madness of Dam Square and the red light district, but not close enough to feel engulfed by it. It's also easy walking distance to the Jordaan and Niewmarkt areas. Breakfasts were good (those little pancakes were delightful), and there is free coffee from the machine whenever you want, as well as a kettle and (stocked) fridge in the room. It's not a place for small children - lots of steep stairs/breakable objects, but for couples or families with older children, it's ideal. We'll certainly be back when we go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RetroRovers
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel as a special stay for my Fiancee's 40th as we wanted somewhere small and intimate but with style. I could not have got it more right! Both Berry and Marcel are the perfect hosts and did everything to make our stay very special. On arrival there were beautiful flowers in the room and a complimentary bottle on bubbly in the fridge to set the mood perfectly. We could not fault the room which was on the ground floor overlooking the canal. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom a good size with underfoor heating and a seprate shower and bath - perfect! The breakfast was held in the back room which still had the original beams from the 16th century and was tastefully decorated with vintage tables and chairs. The food was always good quality with fresh meat's and cheese's with bread so fresh that they were still warm when you cut them. With excellent Tea and Coffee as well what more could you ask for. Mauro Mansion runs an "Honesty Bar" which is a great idea as they do not charge stupid money for the beer, wine and snacks that other Hotels do and with your mini bar in the room being complimentory for the initial stock in there this made for a cheap way to have a few drinks before you went out. I could go on forever about how good this hotel is but I will let you find out for yourselves. Do not stay anywhere else in Amsterdam unless you crave for the multi-national chain hotel with cardboard service! Simply the best! Shelly and Sean

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, great owners & staff!!”
Reviews.Author: chris97975
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel/bed n breakfast type place. Very secure and convenient to "old Amsterdam". Wonderfully large rooms & bathrooms by European standards (and American too). Great breakfast in the morning to start your day of exploring off correctly! I'd stay here again and again every time I came back to Amsterdam...without question. Owners/staff very accommadating with ALL requests.

Reviews.Title: “complete attention to detail & perfect hosts”
Reviews.Author: dreabklyn
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion is amazing -- better than a home away from home. Luxury sheets, bath products, and even heated floor tiles made for the most comfortable travel stay ever. Marcel & Barry are perfect hosts -- ready with wonderful tips and recommendations, but also give you space to relax and enjoy their chic hotel. The food was perfect -- unlimited loose leaf tea and cappuccino + lovely freebies like chilled prosecco & wine glasses in the room. I've never felt compelled to review a hotel, but this one is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, WOW, WOW.....Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: spenspen
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say... Perfect? Great? Sublime? Luxurious? Heaven? Chic? Boutique? .....Well all of them really! what this hotel does and what marcel and Berry do is the thing most hotels never achieve in a lifetime.....Make a difference! And boy do they do it in style! We went for Valentines and stayed for 4 days and had the most amazing experience, this was helped by Berry and Marcel who made our stay truly unforgetable....Thank you B&M. The hotel is situated within walking distance from everywhere and is in a great location. It is situated only 5 mins walk from central station (turn left out of the station and keep walking until you see the street, then only 100yds down that street). The hotel has the best rooms I have stayed in (and we are hotel snobs I don't mind admitting) with great bathrooms (bath for two, power showers, sublime bedding, free mini bar, TV if you want that etc), they make you very welcome and can give you any info you need and nothing is too much trouble! The breakfasts keep you going most of the day and if you want you can just chill out in the kitchen/lounge area. I recommend the 'Ciel Bleu' resturant if money is no option as myself and my g'friend went for Valentines but be very warned as you pay a lot of money for this once in a lifetime experience (Â£400 + for a experience for two), perfect food (9 courses for us), perfect views over Amsterdam and of course michelin class service. On valentines day we had roses, chocolates and a lovely card waiting for us on our return, we added to it with a bottle of Champagne from the 'honesty bar' (great little touch and soooooo cheap)! Berry & Marcel...Please do not change a thing, you have achieved so much and I promise we will be back soon! If i could put 6 stars on this hotel then I would, i have to say that our visit to this great city was the best I have ever had. Thank you!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: PeteAlexTripStories
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a great wealth of accommodation. I have seen the GREAT and the unbelievably poor in accommodation. I feel this hotel should be given at least 4* and not because it is grand, although it is perfect. It's because of the little things that are not too small for them to carry out. We stayed there for a couple of nights and it was so lovely inside especially with the Jaccuzi in our room free drinks and a well stocked honesty bar that we had second thoughts about going out!! (But come on it's Amsterdam, who stays in)? On arriving one of the gentlemen that owns the hotel told us a little history about the place and a few sights not to miss then promptly took our bags to the room. There are bedrooms on the ground floor so if you have trouble climbing stairs I might mention this. Also on making my booking they sent their own email to confirm and to enquire how we would arrive and if we had enough confidence to find their hotel. They provided further detailed directions than we had from the booking company. I have found so Many more things delightful on our stay and that's not to mention the charms of Amsterdam itself. Oh and I forgot, its just round the corner from EVERYTHING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: hollie2
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review on behalf of my parents, who stayed in Mauro Mansion from 17th to 20th Feb. I booked it for them based on the reviews on tripadvisor. They are home now but are still raving about the hotel and the friendliness and helpfulness of Berry and Marcel. They said it was spotless, brilliant location and one of the guys even spent ages trying to check them in online due a problem with the airline's website. So many thanks to Berry and Marcel and I look forward to staying with you myself in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “We cannot put it into words - close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: TristanOxford
Reviews.Content: We would love to run a hotel, we would love it to be the best in the world, I think these guys would challenge us to that title. Everything about this hotel helped make this one of the most enjoyable weekends we have ever had, thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place - book it now, you'll have no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: Devman101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from three weeks of travel and during our Amsterdam visit we stayed at Mauro Mansion. As all of the reviews before us have stated, we just can't say enough great things about this awesome hotel. We really felt at home - the owners Berry and Marcel are super accommodating and approachable. They helped us out with places to eat and tickets to attractions/museums and every morning they provided a relaxed, casual breakfast experience in the lounge. The rooms were large, incredibly comfortable with big beds and baths and each had its own trendy quirks. Room 12 is great! Thanks for an amazing stay - hoping to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nantucketblabla
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this small/boutique hotel to any one who is thinking about staying in Amsterdam. Five minute walk from central station, very clean and hip decor, excellent breakfast and incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Owners Obviously Love What They Do!”
Reviews.Author: whereisjennifer
Reviews.Content: What a marvelous, well-located gem of a hotel! Berry & Marcel are the genuinely friendly, helpful owners, who plied us with excellent service and fantastic breakfasts during our weekend stay. The hotel is an easy 5-minute walk from the Central Station (which, in turn, is an easy 20-min train ride from the airport), and located along one of the canals. It is especially desirable to be near the Central Station, because all the trams (which are the easiest, fastest way to get around) depart from outside the station. The hotel's lobby is connected to the breakfast room, where people not only eat, but also congregate and chat. There is a laptop for the guest's use. Breakfast is wonderful - fresh-squeezed OJ, an elaborate coffee/cappucino/latte machine (available - free of charge - all day), delicious and warm fresh breads, cheese/meats/etc, fruit, muesli, yogurt, and even fresh loose-leaf teas with disposable teabags. The rooms' minibars are stocked with 6 free drinks upon arrival (beer, soda, juice), and there is also an 'honesty' fridge in the breakfast room with wine, prosecco and sparkling wine, beer, water, sodas, et al. - all very reasonably priced. Our room was very comfortable (great beds, nice bedding) and extremely modish! We had a wonderful view over the canal. In the bathroom, we were well-stocked with Ritual bath products and really nice towels. Special touches abound at the Mauro. We were very appreciative that Berry could generate our front-of-the-line Van Gogh Museum tickets (as well as Rijks Museum tix) and add the charge to our hotel bill, and also was happy to print our boarding passes. Finally, we were extremely impressed that - after mentioning prior to arrival that one of our fellow travelers was gluten-intolerant - Berry & Marcel provided her with high-quality gluten-free breads during the duration of our stay! If I had one very tiny dislike, it was the folding metal chairs in our room - not very comfortable, especially for pregnant gals (2 of us are with-child). But that was certainly outweighed by the avalanche of wonderfulness experienced at Mauro!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gabacorn
Reviews.Content: Barry and Marcel were excellent hosts. They were very helpful with email correspondence before the trip. Mauro Mansion is located feet from the train station and located close to everything. Excellent home made breakfast each morning with local Dutch touches. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable with heated bathroom floors. Located directly on the canal it is very picturesque. Very well done.

Reviews.Title: “A very good situated, clean, nice, cosy little hotel with very friendly holders.”
Reviews.Author: inesIns
Reviews.Content: The Mauro is in the middle of the old town and eventhough calm. The holders Berry & Marcel are always around if you need them and give informations about everything you would like to know. The breakfast is healthy, the quality is high and we go everything our heard disired. Every morning Berry or Marcel brought somethin special, like the small Dutch pankakes or vanillia yoghurt with fresh stawberries or breakfast cakes...hm lovely! The room was very nice and clean. If ever we come back to Amsterdam we will stay again in the Mauro Manison!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: pocky1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a perfect location, just one minute from the station/china town/red light district etc. but in a silent and safe road. From outside the Hotel appears like a private home (which it is for the owners) and also inside You feel home very quickly. There is a breakfast room with kitchen. Guests are free to serve themselves and just then honestly remember what they had and pay for it. Minibar is free. The shower was perfect, built in on the ground, not a tub and the room itself was very specially designed, modern but also with antique furniture as well as a 2nd floor with a metal cage (for decoration or what ever You like...). TV+DVD player and a supply of DVDs in the kitchen. The perfect place to stay for a reasonable price and have the feeling You have Your own apatement in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: ScubagirlDiane
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but feel obligated to write this one since I had such an enjoyable stay at this hotel just a week ago. The location was fabulous. It was a short walk to the train station and DAM square and the Anne Frank house. It was only about 5-10 minutes from the Red light district too. My room was very modern and comfortable and I had a fabulous view from my window. Sitting in the old barber's chair, sipping wine, overlooking the canal, and watching the night fall was quite enjoyable. Many great restaurants are located close by. Barry was an excellent host. He gave me recommendations for restaurants as well as looking up train times for me so I could get to the airport. I especially enjoyed the free wi-fi in the hotel. The hosts make you feel very "at home" in their hotel. I would definitely stay here again and can't say enough about it.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: triptalk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mauro Mansion on a brief trip in December. I booked it because of Tripadvisior reviews as as usual, I was not disappointed. I can't say enough about the place or the hosts who were fantastic. To preface, this is a B&B. The location is perfect, within easy walking distance to the train station. It is located on a small, quiet canal. Our room was great - comfortable and clean with a lovely canal view and table and chairs in front of the window to check your free wifi in the morning. It is in the hub of everything and within walking distance/canal boat to all the great attractions. Above all else, the breakfast was absolutely fantastic with big pieces of delicious fresh baked bread, yogurt, fresh baked goods and the coolest (and delicious) espresso machine I've seen to make instant single cups. Everything was fresh and delicious and all details in the hotel were obviously thought about, even from the simple jug for water for your room. I plan to make it a habit to visit this hotel when in Amsterdam. It is the closest thing to having my own canal apartment!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay ANYWHERE else?”
Reviews.Author: lovetogetaway12
Reviews.Content: LOVED this place!!Terrific location! My husband and I love to travel and wanted to spend the holidays in Amsterdam. We could not have been more pleased with Mauro Mansion. When we arrived, Berry(the wonderful owner) had stocked up on breakfast food to meet my husband's strict dietary restrictions. (I had emailed him prior regarding all his allergies.) He also researched various restaurants that we LOVED and catered to his diet. We couldn't believe for the value for the affordable rate. We had an AMAZING view of a canal. Our room rocked! Very romantic! (room 21) It was decorated BEAUTIFULLY! Our bed was incredibly comfortable (perfect after a busy day out). The heated floor tiles in the bathroom was my husband's favorite, as well as the spacious room. It was so clean,you could literally have eaten off the floors. Lastly, we LOVED our central location, which made traveling in the quaint city very easy. We can't wait to go back to Mauro... hopefully in the summer!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller_50
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with all the previous comments about this small boutique hotel. In an excellent location, close to Centraal Station, Dam Square etc. with comfortable quirky rooms, some of which overlook the canal, this place is a real home from home. Breakfasts were great, the coffee was fantastic and the daily surprise was a bonus. A complimentary mini bar in the room with coke, beer and juice and an honesty bar on the ground floor with very reasonably priced wine and snacks, as well as coffee to go. But what makes this place so special are the people who own and run it; Berry and Marcel are wonderful hosts who are happy to provide recommendations about restaurants, places to visit etc. but without being at all intrusive. I would definitely stay here on my next visit to Amsterdam and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Quinny7
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Mauro Mansion. Rooms, service, breakfast are all superb and the location is perfect. Great recommendations from Berry for nearby restaurants including Eat Me which was excellent for dinner. Won't stay anywhere else from now on when back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: funknyem
Reviews.Content: Berry and Marcel were wonderful. My wife and I spent the first two days of our Honeymoon in Amsterdam. Berry and Marcel had a canal view room ready as we had reserved. The service was impeccable, breakfast delicious and ambiance was the best I have ever had. The location to the train station is great. Getting around the city from this location was no issue at all. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, right in the thick of it!”
Reviews.Author: shrub1990
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1 in the afternoon berry & marcel were really welcoming & helped us with finding our way around Amsterdam. Our room was really clean and no noises from the city, we had the jacuzzi bath which was amazing but pretty loud so i was a little worried about disturbing the other guests. The breakfast is really nice & lots of choice. The location is perfect, 5 min walk from dam square and central station and 2 min to the red light district. Only thing i would say, it looks like a house so we walked straight past it but just look at the street numbers! We would like to thank you Berry and Marcel for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience you could have!!!”
Reviews.Author: KerriAniello
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to amsterdam for his birthday and struggled initially to find a hotel that ticked all the boxes. After reading such great reviews on tripadvisor i decided to book at mauro mansion for 2 nights. All i can say is that the recommendations were not wrong!! The hotel itself is right next to central station and dam square. We arrived early and they took our bags, offered us coffee and use of the restroom and gave us a map to get our bearings. The room was great with nice little quirky features and a complimentary mini bar! The fridge in the room was a great size so we went to the supermarket and bought cheese and wine.The bed was very comfortable and a had two seperate duvets which is a dream come true for me as my partner hogs it all usually!! The bathroom was very clean and i fell in love with the bath tub, in a two night stay i had 3 baths! The breakfast was great and the couple who run the hotel were so attentive bringing a different treat to your table each morning (fruit salad and small dutch pancakes). I must say though the best part about this hotel is the service! Marcel & Berry clearly love their hotel and have built it up from nothing. The little things really made our stay ie. 50% off vouchers for the museum we were visiting that day or the amazing coffee to go. On our last day we had a late flight so we were able to have a later check out and use the living area in the hotel throughout the day. Handy as it was rather cold outside. All i can say is that i highly reccomend this hotel and i will most certainly stay again. I too work in a boutique hotel in Edinburgh so i know that these little things are not a standard for most hotels and was impressed with how attentive and hard working the owners are.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: beardaisy
Reviews.Content: Very good location, confortable and cosy room and bathroom, delicious breakfast. A very good choice. Thanks for all

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pat2
Reviews.Content: When we phoned to say our flight would be delayed by at least 4 hours, we were told "yes, we checked on the internet and noticed you haven't taken off yet, relax, we'll expect you when you arrive". Similarly, when we left in a blizzard we were told if the flight was cancelled "just come back and we'll work something out". I don't know what because this little hotel is fully booked but it's just so relaxing and accommodating to get this kind of service, It's a converted 16th century warehouse with a courtyard, high ceilings, wood floors and creaky floorboards, odd shaped rooms, right on the canal so we got to watch the ducks struggling on the ice and St Niklas arriving by boat. Great breakfast included (fruit, juices, cheese, cereals, variety of breads and toast, yogurt, deli meats, treats), and great coffee and tea 24/7, free soft drinks, "honesty bar" with good wine at 10euros a bottle, and the male couple who run it are warm, honest, very helpful, with attention to detail. Free DVDs and music. Great central area, you can walk everywhere safely. A great Amsterdam experience

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously individual hotel in the centre of Amsterdamn”
Reviews.Author: RobertN8
Reviews.Content: We experienced a fabulous stay at the hotel. Nothing is to much for Berry and Marcel they greeted us and asked what we wanted to do then give us some fantastic advice for our visit. The hotel is fantastically presented and the small touches demonstrate a fantastic eye for detail. The hotel is situated at the center of the city within short walking distance of the central rail station its reasonably priced for what it is and while you may find a cheaper option it will actually be cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY ACCOMODATING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: sotasan
Reviews.Content: Due to bad weather, my flight scheduled to land at Amsterdam at 9pm, didn't land till midnight. Despite the fact that check-in was closed, Mauro's staff stayed up, and directed me to the location when i lost my way. They were extremely accomodating and helpful, giving great advice on getting around the next day. The room was very comfortable and clean. I was only there for one night, but will definitely stay there again next time i'm in Amsterdam. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ipcollins
Reviews.Content: Cannot speak highly enough about this hotel. Was very easy to get to from Central Station, was greeted by owner @ front door upon arrival, rooms were clean and funky, breakfast was delicious and nutritious, very friendly and beautiful touches throughout. If you want to tour museums, buy tickets @ hotel as you bypass long queues. Great free fast WiFi included. Even shower toiletries (Rituals for those in the know) were of high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Verified all other reviews”
Reviews.Author: lockerroom66
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Oct 31 - Nov 5. Agree with all other reviews - hotel location can't be beat- literally 5 minutes walk from train station, near Dam Square, Red Light. Hosts are incredible - great recommendations, knowledgeable, helpful - great suggestions for restaurants, etc. Rooms were clean, and very large for what you normally get in Europe. Welcome stocked minibar a very nice touch (Heineken, Pepsi, OJ). Great breakfast as was mentioned - the 'daily treats' were another special touch.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: aliceyyy
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful to me a solo traveller. Good recommendations for places to visit. Helpful in buying museum tickets at the hotel, saving time queuing! Deco are just great. Typical dutch style breakfast in a lovely breakfast room, with music playing. Great to start a day! On top of this is a little "surprise" to each guest every morning. Really enjoy the stay. Needless to say, superb location. Amsterdam Station Centraal is just opp the road.

Reviews.Title: “Best by far!”
Reviews.Author: FameAsser
Reviews.Content: Having booked our first trip abroad as a couple, my girlfriend and I looked on Trip Advisor for a decent hotel to stay at in Amsterdam. Having read previous fantastic reviews, we decided to check it out for ourselves. We have to wholly agree that every good word said about the Mauro Mansion is 100% true. The location is ideal for anyone getting dropped off near the Central Station as it was only a five minute walk to the hotel. We arrived a little early to the hotel but were greeted warmly by our hosts who allowed us to drop our bags off and recommended some good places nearby to head for lunch. We returned to the hotel a little while later and were shown our room, to which our luggage had been delivered for us. The room was magical. We were up on the top floor and to our delight we were in the room with the Barbers Chair which was a lovely addition to the beautiful room. The bed was magnificently comfy and we knew we would be having a good nights sleep on there. Complimentary chocolates, drinks and bathroom products added to a very impressive first opinion. The bathroom had a jacuzzi-type bathtub and a walk-in shower, all with the added benefit of under-floor heating. A "Honesty Bar" was a nice touch too, allowing you to pick up drinks and snacks at any time of the day or night and just declare them upon checking-out and were all at a very reasonable price. There is also a fine selection of DVDs to enjoy in your room at your leisure. Nothing was too much trouble for our hosts who even allowed us to leave our bags in their care so we could enjoy our last day of sightseeing without lumbering our bags around with us. The breakfast was exquisite, with fresh bread, ham, cheese, salami, and yoghurts available as well as a lovely addition of Strawberries and Yoghurt to start with. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam Centre but set back enough to ensure a good night's sleep will be enjoyed. All-in-all, a very impressive hotel which we would love to stay in again in the very near future. The only downside was that we were only there for one night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: FarhanGreham
Reviews.Content: Totally a great experience we've had here, unmatched perfection in all sorts. Excellent service - minded staffs and nice hospitality.Truly a nice hotel to deal with.Rooms are in a very good condition , fine food and thats all about it fine and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: ACC10
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for the October bank holiday weekend. Between the two of us we've travelled quite a bit and visited quite a few european cities. We have stayed in the big hotel chains but this boutique style hotel won us over. I can safely say that this hotel is by far the best we've stayed in. The room was very quiet, the hotel was spotlessly clean. Marcel and Berry were welcoming and helpful but not overbearing. Breakfast was self service but don't let this put you off. There was plenty of food available with fresh bread baked each morning. We were also given a different dish, of fresh fruit or pancakes for example, every morning. There was fresh coffee available all day and dvds, books and cds there for us to use during our stay. We had a jet bath, complimentary mini bar ...! The attention to detail and small touches really made this place special!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hospitality That We Didn't Even Know Still Existed”
Reviews.Author: kendallrich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon where we started in Paris and then traveled to Amsterdam for a 4 day stay until we headed back to Paris. Unfortunately we made the mistake to book through BOOKINGS.COM from this website. DO NOT DO THAT! Email Mauro Mansion directly. When we arrived to Mauro Mansion they did not have our reservation as bookings.com never sent it. My husband and I were upset to say the least because all of the hotels in the city were booked because there was a city marathon. So it seemed we were stuck with no where to stay....BUT THEN... Berry the owner found us a beautiful hotel for one night and then a precious B&B the next 3 nights and we were saved! Not only did he find us some wonderful accommodations, he paid for the difference! We are still in shock that he was so kind to do that, I do not think we would have found that same sort of hospitality anywhere else. Hence why their card has the literal definition of HOSPITALITY. We will definitely be booking with them on our next day!!! PS. The hotel looked beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very good price!!”
Reviews.Author: bella6404
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Wish we had more time but were only booked in for 2 days. Fantastic service and very clean. The owners just love what they do. Attention to detail with only the traveller in mind. In a great central location and fairly quiet. Wonderful breakfast. Definitely a place to stay and if we ever are in Amsterdam again we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireMarakesh
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Marcel and Berry were friendly and informative without being intrusive. Good recommendations about dining out. Hotel was well appointed, beds and pillows comfortable and everything worked.

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason they are #1!”
Reviews.Author: wwtraveler11
Reviews.Content: I am really not sure I have anything to add that other reviewers havenâ€™t said! The location canâ€™t be beat (a 5 minute walk from the central train station). Berry and Marcel were wonderful at suggesting local places to eat (which I have posted two below). The breakfast offered meats, cheeses, breads, cereal, yogurt, coffee, and juice. If you are there on a morning when they serve little pancakes with strawberries, eat one for me! Our room was on the top floor in the back which made it very quiet. The room had a mini-fridge in with some complimentary drinks which was very nice. Also if you enjoy taking a bath, the jetted tub is pretty amazing. Whether you are staying one night or a week; I would totally recommend staying here. FYI (which has nothing to do with the hotel but would have been helpful to know). The train from the airport to central station doesnâ€™t take credit cards without chips (which being from America, ours donâ€™t have). They do take cash but if you are just arriving, you will have to withdraw some euros at an ATM at the airport if you have none on you. Places to eat: CafÃ© Bern-It doesnâ€™t look like much from the outside but the food inside is amazing. I would recommend going with the CafÃ© Burn special which is steak (that gets cooked at your table) and bread in an amazing cheese fondue sauce. I would recommend reservations on the weekend. Van Beeren-A wonderful little cafÃ© that serves some amazing food. It sounds like a weird combination by the shrimp and avocado salad was delicious! For dessert, we had the pastry with ice cream and chocolate sauce. I would also recommend reservations here also.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think about it - Just Book it!”
Reviews.Author: sachaerin
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on tripadvisor and looking at Mauro Mansion's website I decided that this was the place for my husband and I to stay. I am so glad that we stayed here, it was the best decision! We stayed in room 3 on the 1st floor with a view of the canal. It has the really cool barber chair in it! The location is fantastic especially being in close proximity to Central Station (5 minute walk) and so close to all the sites. The huge room was absolutely spotless and really well decorated/appointed. It had great black out curtains and an amazingly comfortable bed which made for a really good night's sleep. The breakfast was perfect and kept me going until late afternoon. Berry and Marcel have outdone themselves with this beautiful boutique hotel. There is nothing that I didn't like about this place....it was absolutely perfect! From the service they provide when you arrive to the moment that you leave there is nothing that I would change. Definitely book this place when you go to Amsterdam, cause I know I will when I go back!

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeamon
Reviews.Content: Marcel and Gerry are great hosts with a lovely property. The room we had overlooked the canal, it was quite spacious and quiet. Breakfast was simple but of high quality and Marcel always had a little special item for us - fresh strawberries and pancake skewers, for instance. The guys were very personable without being intrusive and were so helpful when we needed to make reservations at a particular restaurant. There is always a selection of snacks available downstairs, along with an incredible coffee machine. The location is great in that it is very close to the Centraal Station, from which you can go just about anywhere. It is in the "Red Light District" but walking into town requires minimal exposure to those elements. All in all, it was a fantastic stay and we will certainly stay again if/when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: eek_19
Reviews.Content: You can tell that the owners have have put a LOT of thought and care into every detail of the hotel. The room had everything we'd want: comfortable bed and pillows, reading lights, iPod charger/clock, fridge with complimentary drinks, a great shower, excellent wi-fi, in-room safe, and treats on our pillows every night. Downstairs in the common area were a Mac we could use, DVDs to borrow, and an honesty bar with wine, drinks and snacks. Breakfast was my favorite of the trip: we could serve ourselves from a very high-quality selection, plus a different fresh fruit dish served each day. The location was terrific - right near the train station, overlooking a canal. I was worried that it would be noisy because it was so central, but it wasn't at all. Marcel and Berry were really helpful about restaurants and information. I can't imagine a better hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very central - great service”
Reviews.Author: Karla
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights for a long weekend in a courtyard room which was spacious and spotlessly clean. As the name suggests it did not have a canal view (we booked late) and the room was located on the first floor which meant you could hear a little noise from the room above - no doubt partially as the decor is very modern and lacks noise absorbing soft furnishing or carpets (but nothing which affected our stay adversely). Saying that, the room had everything we needed, including a sofa, a small fridge with some free drinks, a large bathroom with a bath and walk-in shower. The hosts as others have pointed out are very friendly, efficient and always at hand - we boughts tickets to the Rijksmuseum from them and thus avoided the queues; every night we double-checked our restaurant choices with them and they booked us a table where needed; and at breakfast time when an item was not available at the first morning they placed it on our table the next mornings. Breakfasts were lovely, crusty fresh breads, great coffee and always a different 'surprise' brought to your table - e.g. Dutch pancakes with strawberries. The location of the hotel is perfect - both for getting to the airport (via the station) and for sightseeing - the canal boats stop only a few yars away too.

Reviews.Title: “Can we give six stars?”
Reviews.Author: PortugalKate
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance had stayed in Mauro Mansion for two unforgetable nigths..one of them to celebrate our aniversary, and we couldn't ask for more. First of all, Berry and Marcel are excelent hosts. You feel a autentic concern with your confort, not just a number in an unpersonal chain hotel. According to the purpose of your visit they try to give the best advices and sugestions. Our's were romantic, so they prepare to us a wellcome drink and recomended a great romantic place for our special dinner. But don't think this is just a romantic hotel, because even if you are visiting Amsterdam for other reasons, the give very usefull tips, not just the tipical tourist routes but places you can trust to better reflect the Dutch life. Location is very good: 2-3 min from centraal Station, very easy to get there by walk. Near the main tourist points like Dam Square (5 min) and the famous Red Light distrit. But don't be afraid, it isn't "IN" the red light...Actually the street of the hotel is very quiet and safe all day, but you can easily reach the night life just a few corners away. Rooms are spacious like you wouldn't excpect in a channel house. We've stayed in the top floor and had a channel view, and it was great. Didn't hear any noise, neither from the street or other rooms. Private Bathube, large LCD, coffee and tea supllies and a nice bed. If you want a good breakfast, their's is even better. Homemade bread, natural fruit juice and a great coffee machine, that you can use anytime. We sure will stay here again when we come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dcaeiro
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast, great service, rooms immaculate clean. Been one week in a business trip and I truly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful B&B”
Reviews.Author: Gaffeur
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a business trip. Excellent up-market B&B. Interesting and unusual decor, but good bathrooms and very comfortable. Breakfast room is super with a simple but delicious and filling breakfast. Superb location, especially for arrival. Take the train from Schipol to the Central Station. It's a 5 minute stroll from there. Very warm welcome, and everything in central Amsterdam is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: ahiptragedy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just so lovely. The staff is incredibly warm and helpful. I absolutely intend to stay here again on any subsequent trips to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Joe_of_Sydney
Reviews.Content: first time to amsterdam and wanted something affordable and decent ... mauro mansion exceeded all expectations .... the hotel itself is a building embedded with history ... the room was spacious and quiet and they have great beds .... it also is located centrally and located to all amenities (amsterdam is a small city you can walk everywhere)... Berry and Marshall are the best hosts you can ask for, they make you a great breakfast and are extremely friendly - I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: carl_maybry
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this place in the slightest. Berry and Marcel were great hosts. Berry gave us some great suggestions for food in the area. Both were amazingly friendly and were on hand with advice or a chat when ever we needed it. Rooms were very clean, the breakfast was lovely, location is literally 3 minutes from the train station and is just outside the hussle and bussle of Amsterdam which meant a good nights sleep. We thought 150 Euros was a little steep before hand but then it is the capital of The Netherlands and would be on par with a London Boutique hotel. If/when we come back to Amsterdam this will be my first port of call when looking for a hotel. Thanks Mauro

Reviews.Title: “A totally wonderful and positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: Danac106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel! It is an easy (maybe 5 min.?) walk from Amsterdam Centraal Station. It's on a quiet street, with a canal. The Nieuw Markt is very close, also Chinatown, and also the Red Light District -- but it's definitely not in the Red Light District. Because it's near Centraal Station, you have easy access to the Canal Boat Tours and also the trolleys (trams), so you can travel all over the city very easily. Berry and Marcel are very friendly and welcoming. Our room and the bathroom were both very attractive, roomy and clean. We stayed for three nights and would have been glad to book additional nights but they were booked. Very good breakfast: bread, diverse cheeses and meats, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, wonderful coffee and tea. Also two of our three mornings there we were given something special from the kitchen. We asked for tap water the first morning, and every morning thereafter it arrived at our table -- they remembered! The Swiss breakfast waitperson was especially friendly, thank you! They also did our laundry free of charge!! There is no question: when we are next in Amsterdam we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “a personal, friendly spot in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: katiejwatson
Reviews.Content: My friend and I fell in love with this place. It's bang in the centre of town down a really pretty street overlooking the canal. Its run by really friendly guys, who make you feel really welcome. They do a gorgeous breakfast and the general atmosphere there is really chilled - great if you're looking for a relaxing break. The rooms are really impressive too - very spacious and the jet bath was also a nice surprise! I'd certainly recommend this place and would go back myself :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: samiyam
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at Berry and Marcel's other guest house - Fort Amsterdam - conveniently on the same road a few doors down - we were planning to stay there again and were disappointed when it was booked. I was however directed to their NEW boutique hotel and booked it without hesitation. I won't repeat what most people have said about the amazing breakfast, personal touches and friendly, warm nature of the hosts but I will add that if you do stay here, you will not want to stay anywhere else. It is great value for money, in a great location - the orange bike hire across the road is sooo convenient! - and has everything you need and more for a perfect stay. Our room with the barbar chair (??) over looked the canal and was so lovely, even when it was raining cats and dogs, we were content in our lovely room until it passed. P.S for you spa lovers, grab a bike, jump on the train to Haarlem and check out the Sauna Van Egmond( 4 Van Egmond straat). It is a truly amazing place!! To Berry and Marcel, thanks again as always! Sam & Neville XX

Reviews.Title: “Charming, spacious and indulgant”
Reviews.Author: nofish7
Reviews.Content: Berry and Marcell were excellent hosts. The room we stayed in was very spacious and interesting (antique barber chair in our room!). It was in a great location...within easy walking of the Central Train Station, but situated on a beautiful canal in the old district. Though it is somewhat close to the red light district, this was not a problem at all. IIt was great for a romantic getaweay and we would definately return

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rach25
Reviews.Content: Everything about Mauro mansion is perfect!!!! The rooms are spectacular, we stayed in a courtyard room! Which had its own jacuzzi! It was amazing!! Berry & Marcel couldn't enough for you! They were great! Dont bother reading through thousands of reviews (like i normally do!!) for hotels in Amsterdam.....just book this one!! You will not be disappointed! We stayed in 3 other european hotels on this holiday and this was by far the best! Its a few minutes walk from central station, great breakfast, they let us check in early.....honestly couldn't ask for anything more!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the hosts are the GREAT people!”
Reviews.Author: Oleg_Rus
Reviews.Content: At first, weâ€™d like to mention about the hosts â€“ Berry and Marcel. Itâ€™s difficult to find nowadays so kind, so careful people who want to make your stay unforgettable. They were interested in what the travellers would like to visit, gave maps and helpful guides, suggested to visit some unique places in Amsterdam. Their breakfasts were astonishing: the products were kept in so stylish fridge, each day hosts made some surprise, the bread was just baked and every morning was started with so nice and relax music which made calm atmosphere to enjoy your meal. The room was always clean and the flowers in vase just only pointed the will of the hosts to made the unique atmosphere of home comfort and delight of stay for the travellers. Berry and Marcel, thank You very much for your cordiality. You are the GREAT!!! Oleg and Sergey from Russia

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam at its best”
Reviews.Author: freecycle3
Reviews.Content: I was directed to the Mauro Mansion with my girlfriend after my reservation at another place fell through. How lucky we were that fate dealt us such a hand! The rooms are fantastic, the owners great, and the location situated on a quiet canal near the train station. There's so much more to this city than dancing hookers and stoned 19 year-olds playing hackie sack--avoid the hostels and treat yourself (it's totally reasonably priced) to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, wonderful and lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Amandine1975
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much to Berry and Marcel, for their warming welcome in their new Boutique Hotel, we stayed 3 nights in this so lovely place, I didn't want to leave Amsterdam ! Mauro Mansion is a new Boutique Hotel, it should be a top secret address, It is a GREAT hotel, comfortable, newly refurbished ans decorated with an excellent taste and style, the rooms are very comfortable, with a lot of very nice things ans many services, just for our comfort, so nice ! Breakfast is just wonderful, delicious with top products, a great moment ! Just 4 words : Go to Mauro Mansion, you have never been in a such boutique hotel before !! If I come back soon to Amsterdam, I won't look for an other hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent time - the room was...”
Reviews.Author: Delforit
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent time - the room was great always clean. The owners where very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with quality and taste”
Reviews.Author: Moncaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mauro Mansion last weekend and we loved it! Such nice people and the hotel has been decorated with wonderful taste and style. Our breakfast were made with love: from the just baked bread to the natural yogurt. We are very happy to recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have a great break in Amsterdam. Carolina & Paul

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smat009
Reviews.Content: For our Japanese visitors, Mauro is very interesting hotel. Thanks Berry and Marcel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAshley529
Reviews.Content: We had a blast staying here in Amsterdam. Berry and Marcel were very hospitable and helpful. The helped us reserve a private canal tour which was one of the highlights of our stay. The rooms are all unique and have a fresh modern style. The location is excellent- it's in a great area and right near the train station. We will definitely return here when we come back to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Charming house in a great location with perfect hosts”
Reviews.Author: Saarbrucken
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion seems just perfect for any kind of stay in Amsterdam! I combined a business trip with leisure, staying a few extra days after a large conference/meeting, and was completely happy with this place. Mauro just has it all: Only a few minutes from central station yet located on a quiet canal, a beautiful old house newly renovated with great care and great taste, this hotel is a little gem offering all the comfort you could wish for (including free, perfectly reliable high speed internet). Have any questions about restaurants in walking distance, things to do, public transportation, parking? The owners are always happy to help. Oh, and I loved the little suprises that are freshly prepared for the guests in the mornings! (Make sure you stay long enough - it would be a pity to miss the mini pancakes with fresh strawberries for breakfast! :-) What can I say... Mauro Mansion is a truly great alternative to the usual business hotels, and I will definately return during my next visit to Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, quirky, and lots of personal touches - we love!”
Reviews.Author: thebogwoppit
Reviews.Content: Lovely welcome from the hosts Marcel and Berry who were very attentive throughout our stay. They helped us to orientate ourselves on arrival and gave us some tips on places to go for food which were excellent but which we wouldn't have discovered ourselves. The overall relaxed atmosphere of the hotel was just right. The mini bar has snacks on arrival and you can then top up as required during your stay. Breakfast is self-serve and as the hotel describes is based on quality not quantity. I would concur. All of the items are of a very high standard, there is enough variety and we left each morning very satisfied. We had room 34 which was on the top floor because his nibs wanted a bath. This room has a large jacuzzi bath which was very nice. I loved the quirky features of the room, the beams and ladder although what the ceiling height metal cage is about we forgot to establish! Mauro is conveniently located just off the red light district, don't be put off by thinking it is too close, it's not. It's also handily close to the train station again without being too close. Being right in town means that if you are visiting for a few days you can walk everywhere. We loved that we could pop back to the hotel easily by foot for a relax pre-evening. Having worked in a number of hotels in my teens I do make for a picky hotel guest. Mauro was a delight to stay in for the reasons described above and the nice touches like the surprise breakfast item each morning: mini pancakes one day, omelettes, the next, and then fresh pineapple. Mauro really had the values of an independent hotel that we were seeking with lots of personal touches.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hosts, perfect location, super tasty breakfast and nice interior design!!!!”
Reviews.Author: renda73
Reviews.Content: Mauro Mansion is in a perfect location for exploring the old town of Amsterdam, it is in a quite street facing a canal; staff are kind, helpful and very attentive to details. The building and the interior have been recently renovated.so everything is brand new; the room we stayed in was spacious and with all comforts! Strongly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: sho4mom
Reviews.Content: Great location, on quiet street, overlooking a canal. Nicely decorated theme rooms and Marcel and Berry are incredible hosts, very accommodating and helpful. Enjoyed the morning breakfast provided with fresh breads, cold cuts, cheese, yogurt and a special treat each morning. Bike rentals are directly across the canal. This is the best way of getting around town.

Reviews.Title: “great location, lots of character, accommodating hosts”
Reviews.Author: sunshinetraveller100
Reviews.Content: this beautiful old building is walking distance from centraal station, the red light district (without being too near the noise of either) and right on a canal. the owners were lovely and helpful, breakfasts were yummy, rooms full of character with funky/chic decor. Beds could have been comfier, but overall great value in Amsterdam and i plan to return thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “In people we trust”
Reviews.Author: indreks
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Mauro Mansion was perfect. Hosts Berry and Marcel, were both more than helpful and made our vacation in Amsterdam as pleasant as possible. Especially the breakfasts were marvellous, each day some surprise. Also they kept in mind to make our son's visit memorable - little details as small Holland supporters attributes were nice thoughts and made him feel special. That kind of reception and personal contact with guests are possible only then, when you have small number of rooms in hotel and the hosts are nice persons. Mauro Mansion's house itself with it's history, high ceilings and wooden beams is marvellous. And off-course - the view to canal.... I wish Berry and Marcel all the best. Indrek from Estonia, 10-15.06.2010

Reviews.Title: “I had a good night sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Lennoxzenon
Reviews.Content: Where else would you find fresh flowers in your room? Where else would you find fresh squeezed orange juice for breakfast in the morning? Marcel and Barry were wonder hosts. This was my first time visiting Amsterdam. Marcel went out of his way to help me orient myself in the city. He even looked up bus schedules and went on-line to book museum tickets for me. 5 minutes walk from the Centraal Station. The room and bathroom were sparkling clean. Bed was comfortable. I appreciated the bed lamp with an integrated i-pod dock. Missing was an elevator but it shouldn't be a problem unless you travel like Diana Ross on tour.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, excellent location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTko
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and had an excellent stay in Amsterdam. Very convenient location and very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with first class service and stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: RichSC
Reviews.Content: As this place as just opened, it might well be a hidden gem at the moment but if there is the availability, make sure you book a room! We stayed on the 3rd floor in a 'Courtyard room' which featured a jacuzzi bath, Ritual bath products, and an Ipod dock and TV/DVD player in the main room. Service was also exemplary with a full breakfast buffet in the morning which runs from 9am to 11am, which was great for me as I enjoy taking things more slowly on holiday rather than being up at the crack of dawn. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: JimVitanos
Reviews.Content: Berry and Marcel made us feel like family. Beautiful building with many nice touches. Room was perfect and the location is in just the right spot...on a quiet side street within walking distance to all the great restaurants, historical sites, and public transportation. Easily the best place we stayed during our vacation. Thanks guys, look forward to seeing you again sometime soon. Delia and Jim

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: dj_int
Reviews.Content: From Amsterdam Central station we walked ~5minutes to find a freshly restored mansion entrance (very secure) right on a quiet canal. Inside, the colors, cleanliness, marble, ancient wood rafters, tall ceilings, beautiful bathroom and tastefully chosen remnants of past inhabitants contributed to a really pleasant first two days in Amsterdam. Berry and Marcel were very helpful, quick to utilize internet to supply information and breakfasts were delightful..fresh juices, granola, yogurts etc. and rich deep dark coffee. Convenient to metro/surface city train, buses and perfect for just local exploring. We saw Snow Patrol. Will stay here when we visit again.

HotelInfo.Name: Mauro Mansion
HotelInfo.Address: Geldersekade 16, Amsterdam 1012 BH, The Netherlands
